loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be honest.

Vincent operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, milk, cooking fat and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

He will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is 23 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Hayk lives with his mother, brother, and grandmother. Hayk has vocational medical education and a specialty as a dentist but he never worked in that field. Now he works in a private company as a driver-distributor.  At the same time Hayk is greatly interested in agricultural work and he manages a farm with his mother. 

On his plot of land, Hayk cultivates beans, potatoes, tomatoes and greens. Some vegetables Hayk uses for sale and the other part for his family. Now, with this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Hayk wants to repair the water tank of his vegetable garden, to lay water pipes around the garden, and he also wants to buy vegetable seedlings.

loans.use: to repair the water tank of his vegetable garden, to lay water pipes around the garden, and to buy vegetable seedlings also

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush is from Gugarq village. She lives with her husband and two little children. Vardanush and her husband's only occupation is farming. They keep livestock (two cows, calves, hens and turkeys) and also cultivate potatoes in the family yard, near the house. 

Among numerous maintenance problems in her farm, Vardanush wants to solve the one that is the most urgent now -- she wants to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and also to purchase four piglets for the farm. 

 As this is Vardanush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative almost 500 borrowers like Vardanush get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Assuring responsible monthly payments of the loan, Vardanush and her husband hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and for four piglets

loans.name: Zee Hpyu Kone Group 2 C

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Nay (in the middle at the picture) is 51 years old, married and lives with the family of four. He farms on his five acres of crop farm and as well plants betel leaves and seasonal fruits. Nay has over 30 years of farming experiences. Both of his daughters are at secondary school and Nay wants them to be schooled till graduation. This fund will help him purchase crop seeds, fertilizer and other inputs for his farm. As school fees are expensive and schools are far from villages, many parents try to keep their children till high school.

Pictured above are the member of the group named Myint, Nay, San, Than and Zin. This fund will help the group purchase fertilizer and crop seeds. Zee Hpyu Kone village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and its residents mainly focus on crop farming. On the other hand, they also plant seasonal vegetables and betel leaves. Some households also raise pigs, for savings and ducks and to sell duck eggs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, petrol for cropping machines and to pay for labor on the farm

loans.name: Zee Hpyu Kone Village Group B

texts.en:
Ba (first from right in the picture), the CBO leader of the group, is 63 years old, married with a son. He farms his five acres of crop farm and as well plants betel leaves and flowers. Ba aims to expand his crop farm by the end of this year from the help of the Proximity loan. He has been in this crop farming business for more than 50 years and hopes to have better outcomes at farming rates in the following years. As Ba's son is a primary student, he wants him to continue his education into higher school.

Pictured above are the group members from Zee Hpyu Kone Group 2, named Ba, Cho, Mar and Aye. A CBO member oversees a group of six members and this fund will help them purchase fertilizer and other inputs for their farm.

Zee Hpyu Kone village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region and mainly focuses on crop farming. On the other hand, they also plant seasonal vegetables and betel leaves. Some households also raise pigs for savings and ducks for additional income from duck eggs sales.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other inputs for the farm

borrowers.first_name: Zee Hpyu Kone Village Group B

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Akotobu. They are in their sixth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has three members. They sell food(local dishes), banku (cooked corn paste), fish, cloth and slip ons. 

The featured borrower is Jenifer, who is 44 years old and married with two children. This loan benefits the small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Jenifer is a member. She says that she joined ID Ghana four years ago. She joined through an invitation from her sister, who is also a member of the institution. 

Currently, Jenifer has a business preparing and selling local dishes like fufu and soup, banku and stew, and rice and stew. She buys the ingredients, including cassava, plantains, fish and vegetables, to prepare the food and sell to customers. She says that she started business with a little capital she had, and it still needs financial support. That is why she has come to ID Ghana, so that she can grow her business. The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,500 to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients (cassava, plantains, fish and vegetables) to prepare food to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Zee Hpyu Kone Village Group 2 A

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Kyaw, is 49 years old, married and lives with his family of five. Two of his children are students and he wants them to be schooled till graduation. He farms his five acres of crop farm and as well as does plantations. Kyaw and his wife raise pigs and ducks as livestock for savings. Proximity's loan will help him purchase farming materials such a fertilizer and crop seeds. As Kyaw doesn’t have cropping machines, the loan will also help to pay for renting the cropping machines during the time. He hopes to have increased in cropping rate this year than previous years, so that the family would be able to cover both the living and schooling costs for the children.

Pictured above are the members from the group named, Kyaw, Myint, Ni, Tin and Toe. A CBO member oversee the group of seven members. The fund will help this small group to purchase fertilizer and inputs for farming machines.

Zee Hpyu Kone village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and mainly focuses on crop farming. On the other hand, they also plant seasonal vegetables and betel leaves.

loans.use: to purchase crop seeds and fertilizer

borrowers.first_name: Zee Hpyu Kone Village Group 2 A

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells electric items. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of electricals. He hopes that in the future, he will maintain his business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of electrical goods for sale

loans.name: Llancasun  De Arin Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LLANCASUN DE ARIN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Florencia tiene 43 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de hortalizas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios en general agradecen en el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios que salen adjuntos a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud, uno de los socios al momento de tomar la foto voltio la cara y se le tomo de perfil, el socio es un poco tímido pero se compromete para la próxima foto salir bien.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Llancasun De Arin communal bank.  The bank is located in the Calca district, Calca province, Cusco department.

The member, Forencia, is 43 years old and married.  She alternates her daily activities with growing vegetables.  She has been engaged in her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The members are grateful for the loan that was granted, and they pledge to make their established payments.

The photo was taken in two groups because of work.  The members whose photos are attached asked permission to arrive at the meeting late for work and health reasons.  One of the members turned his face, and the photo was taken in profile.  The member is a bit shy, but pledges that the next photo will turn out well.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José tiene 59 años de edad tiene 4 hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar es casado, el se dedica a la cria de chanchos, solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos, el crédito es una ayuda rapida para poder invertir, su sueño es tener mas animales y mejorar su negocio, el desafio es la competencia en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en: José is 59 years old, has four children and is married. He lives in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar. He raises pigs for a living and is requesting this loan for the purchase of pigs. This loan is a quick help to be able to invest. His dream is to have more animals and improve his business; his challenge is competition. In his free time, he likes to do communal labour in the community.

loans.use: to buy animals [pigs].

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

Salome operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Salome hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment to use in her butchery.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is 32 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 6 years. Two of them go to school. He sells coffee and he has been doing this business for the past 10 years. His wife is a business lady. 

With the loan, Gad would like to buy more coffee to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and make savings in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is from Ejmiatsin where she lives with her husband and her parents-in-law. Syuzanna is a professional teacher with many years of experience working with school-aged children. She is a math teacher and after her work at school also provides individual classes to students for university entrance exams. 

Syuzanna has separated a room in her house as a classroom and does her best to provide normal conditions for her students. Syuzanna is now asking for this loan to purchase a laptop and chairs for the classroom which she needs for her classes. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Syuzanna hopes to receive the loan which will help to make her classes more efficient.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop and chairs for the classroom

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is a 47-year-old married woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, then sews it into clothing and sells it to the people of her area. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's wellbeing. 

For the improvement of her business, Suraya has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to consistently meet customers’ demand. This will increase her net income, enabling her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently and increase her net income for improving her family's standard of living

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be a large scale supplier within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and fruits for sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman and she has 2 children. She describes herself to be dynamic. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and fruits for selling

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 29 years old and lives in Kakamega town. He is married and supports 3 people in his family together with his wife.

He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for the last 1 year. Reuben has applied for his 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase a new motorcycle, and he hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profit to maintain his business and support his family.

His future hopes and dreams are to buy more motorcycles and have a stable business so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle with the hope that this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans qui vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Mère d’un enfant, Thérèse vend des céréales dans le quartier pour subvenir aux divers besoins. Thérèse s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Thérèse demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Thérèse désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant
texts.en:
Thérèse, age 50, is a married mother of one who lives in the district of Adidogomé where she practices her activity. She sells cereals in the neighborhood to support some of her household’s needs. She stocks up twice a month at the market.  

Thérèse is seeking this loan to order sacks of rice to bolster her sales and her profits, which will help her husband to provide for their family and support their child’s education.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is 42 years old and he lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region.

Rafik is a student at the paid division of Yerevan State University in the Faculty of Law. He is in the distance learning department. Rafik simultaneously works at the city court. He is married and he has two sons.

Rafik asks for this loan as he must pay his tuition fee for the second semester. He thanks beforehand and mentions that this will be greatly valuable support for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a married woman with 2 children and she describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman and she has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the capital he needed to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him.

Jefferson was able to turn the tide in his favor when he opened a new business line, which is coated chicken (Chicken Joy) vending, and he is making good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune.

Recently, he took a loan to restock his sari-sari store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce and to purchase ingredients for his coated chicken business. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for his family.

loans.use: to restock his sari-sari store and to purchase ingredients for his coated chicken business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Kiva borrower. She has 6 children and operates a farm where she has been involved in business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy farm inputs, like cabbages, to sell and provide income for her family

loans.name: Hesham

texts.en: Hesham is 24, single, and lives with his parents in the same house. He used to be a farmer, but he traveled to Cairo to work in a business fattening cows. After one year in Cairo, he went back home to help his aging father with his business fattening cows. Hesham is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales of butter, milk, and cheese, which will generate more income for his father’s family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25, single, and lives with his father and two brothers in the same house. He has a small business fattening cows. He previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on the due dates. Mohammad is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy two head of cattle to expand his business and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Belardo

texts.en:
Here is Belardo, 44, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is happily married to Lucita and has three children. His wife manages their household and takes care of their children while he works for their living. Life is not easy for them but Belardo tries his best to provide for his family's needs.

Belardo has operated a tricycle for four years already. His tricycle carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Silang, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townpeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. 

He is humbly asking your financial assistance of a 12,000 PHP loan to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle. He wants to ensure safe and continuous service of his tricycle. He values his transportation business since his tricycle service is his sole means of living. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help. His earnings will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Belardo dreams to be successful in his business and aims to buy one more tricycle. He prays for an abundant life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is engaged in writing thesis papers, term papers and other kinds of papers in Kapan town.

She lives together with her parents and 18-year-old brother. Arevik herself is 22 years old but is already a skilled and experienced worker who supports her family financially. 

She has applied for this loan to purchase a printing and scanning machine needed for her work. Because she has no additional finances to purchase it and make her work effective, Arevik decided to ask for a loan from Kiva and SEF. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a printing and scanning machine.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a resident of Hoima, Uganda. He is age 46, married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children who attend school. 

He rides a motor cycle for transport commonly known as Bodaboda supplemented by incomes earned from operating   a retail shop, mainly buying and selling general merchandise such as sugar, soap, bread and other items.  

He hopes to grow and expand his business into wholesale and target bigger profits. He will use the loan to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ethan

texts.en:
Ethan is a single man. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, cooking fat and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

He will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat and other items. This will enable him to increase sales and profits. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Saroeuy

texts.en:
A young mother of two kids, Saroeuy is 28 years old. She lives in the Srey Snom district of the Siem Reap province. Currently, Saroeuy does rice farming to support her family's living conditions, which she has been doing for ten years. She can earn about 46,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save around 21,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. 

Her rice field has been destroyed by insect and pests, and this is the main challenge for her farming business. She is now asking for her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Through this loan, she will use it to buy a hand tractor for plowing her farmland. She hopes for her farming business to gain more yields to update her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for plowing her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chikhulupiliro Group

texts.en:
Ellen is 37 years old, married with five children. She sells secondhand clothes to people in her community. She is requesting for another loan in order to further improve her business as she wants to buy more bales of clothes.

Ellen hopes to send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is from Geghanush village of Syunik region. He is engaged in a meat retail business. Vardan purchases raw meat, processes it and then sells it to local shops.

Wishing to purchase a freezer and refrigerator which he needs for keeping the meat in it, Vardan has applied for this loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Your loan will support Vardan's work as a retailer and he will be grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and freezer for keeping the meat for sale.

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en: Nomatter is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools in her community offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. With profits she made from the loan that she initially received from Kiva, she has been able to pay for her children’s school fees and has earned respect from her community. She was into the poultry business and she managed to do all her repayments. She is requesting a second loan and she wishes to diversify her business to cattle fattening. She really feels if she has the capital to purchase heifers and feed, she will be able to earn a lot of profit in the long run.Thank you for supporting Nomatter’s business!

loans.use: To purchase heifers and feed.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 29 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 2 and 4 years. They both go to school. Philippe sells sorghum and he has been in this business for the past three years. His wife is a business lady. 

With this loan, he would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is a 46-year-old married woman. Her husband has been doing business selling fruits for many years. He is also shown in the photo. Her husband earns a reasonable amount of money to support his family. 

Naziran is a loving mother of 3 children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her activities. For the improvement for her husband's business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently. It will help them to increase their earnings.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently, which ultimately will enable her to cover her utility bills in a timely manner

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is nurse from Gyumri town, where she lives with her husband. She works in a local hospital, and after work, also makes visits to patients' houses. She loves her job and helps people a lot. 

Naira asks for this loan to purchase a medical table and tools needed for providing medical services as a nurse. These purchases will give Naira a separate room for her patients in her house for medical visits. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help Naira to accomplish her goal and provide better conditions to her patients.

loans.use: to pay for a medical table and tools needed for providing medical services as a nurse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 54-year-old married woman running a business selling milk. She has been doing this for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her local area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. Zainab has two children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

Zainab has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales. This will enable her to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales to earn more income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children

loans.name: Timvane Group

texts.en: Catherine is 51 years old and a mother of six children. She sells snacks to people in her area. She is requesting another loan in order to change her business, as she wants to start selling zitenje (fabric/wrappers). She hopes to become self-reliant. Her future plan is to open a wholesale in her community.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old. She is married with two children aged 6 and 9 years. They both go to school. She sells clothes and she has been in the business for the past six years, while her husband is a businessman also. 

With the loan, Josephine would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is 32, married to a housewife, and has one child. He takes care of his father and younger brother who helps him with the family income. 

Taha has a feed sales project and is requesting a 5000 EGP to buy more feed such as corn and wheat to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more feed such as corn and wheat.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo, which will enable her to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Gedeon

texts.en:
Gedeon is a taxi driver from Kapan town of Syunik region. He lives with his wife and 6-year-old son, and is the only breadwinner in the family.

He drives to Kapan-Yerevan-Kapan and receives many orders during the month from his loyal clients who wants high-quality transportation service.

To pay for renovation of the car and to purchase tires for it, Gedeon has applied for this loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will help him a lot and Gedeon hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car and purchase tires for it.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 48 years old and from a very poor family who lives in Kutaisi city, west Georgia. He has an unemployed wife and son, and pensioner aunt. Emzar works hard to satisfy his family's increased needs, but he is unable to tackle the financial difficulties. Emzar works at the railway services, where he gets a fixed salary of about 400 GEL. Apart from this, he cultivates family-owned agricultural land and takes care with of milk cows. He wants to make the agricultural activity more productive and start beekeeping.

Emzar requested a loan from local financial institutions and was rejected several times because of his family's poor living conditions. The start-up program that was created between Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL and purchase a family of bees.
 
Emzar will sell the honey at the local market at a good price and make an additional source of income for his family's well-being. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a family of bees and start beekeeping.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more lengths of cloth for tailoring.

loans.name: Mkongoni Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 40s, is not married and has four kids who are still in school. For the past few years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables. She works from 7 in the morning through midnight daily to make a good monthly profit. 

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, Mkongoni, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Mariam is requesting a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. This will be her second loan. Mariam used her previous loan to restock the missing items in her business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and used her profits to pay school fees and cover household expenses. Mariam dreams of building her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Turwanyinzara Cb Group

texts.en: Christine is a group leader, age 45. She is married with 10 children between 1 and 23 years old. The group is called TURWANYINZARA which means “FIGHT FOR HUNGER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their future. She repairs electronics and has been running a business for 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more radios and televisions for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more radios and televisions for sale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a married man living in Masindi,Uganda. He sells meat in a butcher shop. He begun the business to cater for the family needs. He built rentals that generate more income. He desires to educate his children to university, however, inadequate capital is still affecting his business.

Mario needs a loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more pigs for keeping.

loans.name: Satine

texts.en:
Satine is a young businesswoman from Kapan, Syunik region. She is involved in cosmetics sales and lives with her husband. To be able to purchase  cosmetics to resell to her customers, Satine has applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this young and enthusiastic woman to develop her business.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Chinkhoswe Group

texts.en:
Eliza would like to obtain a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her next farming season. Eliza is married with five children and her husband is also a farmer. Eliza grows different kinds of crops such as maize, groundnuts and cassava.

She plans to buy iron sheets for her house and to send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Batuli, a 45-year-old married businesswoman with three school age children. She managing a cooking business and works from 6am to mid-day daily, and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She  will use the loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and other items for her business. She dreams of building her own house and opening a hotel in the future. 

Batuli will share this loan with her loan group,” Karafuu”, which consist of 3 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase in her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To provide service and maintenance  for his motorbikes (bajaji)

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a mother of five school-aged children. She is married. Magreth makes her family living by managing a shop selling spare parts for different trucks. She starts doing business from 6 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her sixth loan request from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Magreth will use this loan to replenish her shop's spare parts inventory. She dreams of buying a car for her business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop's spare parts inventory

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is a 42-year-old mother of seven children, ages 7-20. Vestine owns a retail store in which she sells several items such as shoes, traditional fabric, rice, and sugar. She would like a loan to buy more items for sale in order to make more profits and with the profits she wishes to put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy more of the items she sells, such as shoes, traditional fabric, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Wendys Yolandys

texts.es:
Wendys una joven de 27 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 8 y 7 hombre y mujer respectivamente residente de la ciudad de Sincelejo, una zona donde hay pocas oportunidades laborales, pero nacen emprendedores y personas con la mentalidad ganadora de Wendys de no quejarse y por el contrario buscar cómo puede producir ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Wendys se dedica a a la venta de mercancía por catálogo, como lo es ropa, pijamas, lociones, accesorios, por lo general trabaja a encargos y brinda comodidades de cuotas a sus clientes.

Ya que una forma de traer usuarios es brindar comodidades de pago, se convierte a su vez en su principal problema ya que recoger la cartera puede tornarse demorado y en un nuevo pedido se queda sin capital.

Wendys quiere solicitar un préstamo, la razón es que necesita capital de trabajo para pagar un encargo de ropa, lociones, accesorios que tiene en carpeta.

Su principal sueño y meta es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wendys is a 27-year-old young woman.  She is the mother of two children—a 7-year-old girl and an 8-year-old boy.  She lives in the city of Sincelejo, an area where there are very few job opportunities.  However, entrepreneurs and people with a winning attitude like Wendys emerge, not complaining but, on the contrary, looking for how she can produce an income to support her family.

Wendys works selling catalog merchandise such as clothing, pajamas, lotions, and accessories.  In general, she works on order and offers the convenience of installment payments to her customers.

Because one way of attracting customers is offering the convenience of a payment system, this becomes, at the same time, her main problem.  This is  because making collections turns into a delay, and she winds up without capital for her new order.

Wendys wants to ask for a loan because she needs working capital in order to pay for an order of clothing, lotions, and accessories that is coming up.

Her main dream and goal is to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to pay for an order of clothing, lotions, and accessories that she has in the queue.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: A 45 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et avec ses trois enfants, elle vit dans le quartier de Baguida. Akossiwa est une marchande de chaussures qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Akossiwa réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Akossiwa nécessite ce  nouveau crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa, age 45, is a married mother of three who lives in the district of Baguida. She sells shoes as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood. She buys merchandise twice a month at a local market. Her activity is very profitable. 

Akossiwa is seeking this new loan to stock up on shoes and bolster her profits. She wants to help support her children’s academic education.

loans.use: to buy 14 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Doroka

texts.en:
Doroka is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. 

For the past three years, Doroka has been working hard to manage her poultry business where she rears chicken. To help expand her business, she requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feed, and will help Doroka generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Doroka is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is 32 years old. She owns a general store in which she sells rice, sugar, and Irish potatoes. She has been running this business for the past five years. She would like a loan to buy more items for sale and with the profits, she wishes to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: to buy more items for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a mother of two children who are ages six and four years old and they are both in school. Beatrice owns a general store in which she sells different items such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, and salt. She would like a loan to buy more items such as soap and sugar for sale and fill her store in order to make profits. With the profits she wishes to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soap and sugar for sale

loans.name: Erika Rosa

texts.es:
Erika es una joven de 25 años de edad que junto con su pareja están realizando un proyecto de vida donde los acompaña sus tres hijos de 7, 6, 4 años de edad, cuando hablamos de un proyecto juntos es irse a vivir todos en un hogar y para ello Erika está aportando su granito de arena puesto que su pareja recibe un salario básico que apenas si alcanza para cubrir las necesidades de primera clase.

Pensando en tener una mejor calidad de vida, de vivir felices, de sacar a su familia adelante Erika en el año 2014 inicio con al venta de mercancía por catálogo como lo es lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, cremas, entre otras y estos ingresos han servido para el mantenimiento y mejora de las condiciones en su hogar, puesto que tienen sus hijos estudiando, han ido adquiriendo elementos para el hogar y no pasan necesidades.

Erika para seguir impulsado su negocio desea solicitar un préstamo pata la compra de surtido de productos de aseo personal, lociones y maquillaje
texts.en:
Erika is a 25-year-old young woman. Along with her partner she is making a life plan accompanied by her children ages 7, 6, and 4 years old. The life plan is for all of them to live together in a home. In order to do this, Erika is doing her bit to help since her partner receives a basic salary that barely covers their basic needs. 

In 2014 Erika started selling catalog merchandise with the thought of having a better quality of life, living happily and of getting her family ahead. Erika sells lotions, deodorants, makeup, creams and other things. This income has been used to maintain and improve the conditions of her home since their children are in school. They have been acquiring items for the home and are not in need. 

Erika is requesting a loan to continue driving her business by buying an assortment of personal care products, lotions and makeup.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of personal care products, lotions and makeup.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en: Waleed is 29, married to a housewife, and has a baby girl. He has a small livestock-raising project and previously requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE which he successfully repaid on the due dates. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more cattle to increase his sales of cheese, milk, and butter and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for his livestock-raising project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, wire, nails, etc. to change the roof on her kitchen.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a 45-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 18 and 8, all attend school.

Clementine and her husband have owned a small shop for 4 years  and sells rice, posho, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and  beer.

loans.use: to purchase rice, posho, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and  beer.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 36, married and has three children. He has small business selling cement and gypsum. He previously requested a loan from TADE and successfully repaid it by the due date. He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more building materials to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
Quiché is known as a rich agricultural area where farmers also raise livestock. The population has a strong work ethic with women playing an important traditional role in their families. The land is bordered by heavily wooded forests. Women in this area wear traditional outfits or “traje”. The area is predominanty of Mayan descent with the K’iche people being the largest ethnic majority. The department is named after them. 
Seven dedicated businesswomen have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank's Shalom Group, meaning peace.  The majority of them are involved in commercial ventures selling cosmetics, clothing and snacks. Another sells shoes through a catalog. 
María is the 57-year-old president of the Trust Bank group. She has seven children. She has a winning positive attitude and leadership skills. She sells drinks inside the local market as well as snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, vegetables, lemons and fruit for her menus, as well as cups, plates and plastic glasses. Her ultimate goal is to save enough of her earnings to build a house. All of her children are in various levels of schooling and she wants to have enough available funds for their continued education.
The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge, combining loans and education, is most important for these women. At their monthly meetings, they learn about many topics from a Friendship Bridge facilitator that are very useful in their lives. Some of the subjects covered include health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as empowerment and self-esteem. The ladies also gather important business management tools like budgeting, accounting and customer service.
Gratitude goes to Kiva investors for funding loans for these women so that they can be agents of change in their families and communities.

loans.use: to purchase corn, vegetables, lemons and fruit for her menus, as well as cups, plates and plastic glasses for her scack business.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Flor Del Lago Santa Catarina Group

texts.en:
Santa Catarina Palopo is on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Most of the population is indigenous Kaqchikel Maya. Kaqchikel is commonly heard although Spanish is widely understood. Fishing and subsistence agriculture are the way most of the population survives with a growing market for tourism. The traditional outfits or “traje” of the women is most distinctive with their beautiful blue and green patterned “huipiles” or blouses and ornate wrapped head dresses.

Eight active and hard-working women, who form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Flor del Lago Santa Catarina Group are requesting their second loan that they hope will be financed by Kiva investors. Virginia, a 47 year old mother of eight children, has a handicraft and jewelry business. She creates shawls, scarves, hats and traditional pieces of clothing like “huipiles” or blouses, as well as “fajas” or belts. She also fabricates many lovely items made of beads like coin purses, earrings, bracelets and necklaces. Her short-term goal is to open another business that would be a convenience store. Her next loan should enable her to save up enough to make this dream a reality.  Virginia is requesting a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her jewelry and textile businesses.

Virginia and her friends in the Trust Bank are very aware of the value of education. Two of Virginia’s children are in high school and the rest study in elementary and junior high school. Many of the ladies in the Trust Bank have had little or no education and for this reason, they look forward to the educational section of their monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge facilitator. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

All of the women in the“Flor del Lago Santa Catarina Group Trust Bank send their thanks to each Kiva investor for their kindness and generosity. We look forward to providing a follow up report on Virginia and the ladies in the Trust Bank in the near future!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her jewelry and textile businesses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary a married woman with six children between the ages of 4 and 14 years old. She and her husband own a small restaurant and  shop to sell tomato sauce, posho, sugar, rice and toothpaste. She will save the profits and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomato sauce, posho, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.en:
Luis is a 27 years old married man who owns a stationery shop in a town called Apartadó, his principal customers are students that come to his place to make photocopies and to buy stuff for their classes like pens, papers, books and different things that he sells.

Knowing what kind of customers he has, he suffers the consequences that the public educative Colombian system has, like some strikes, complicating his job, however he stays positive and dreams big, like having more establishments in the future. He needs a loan so he can buy a big photocopier so it lets him male the huge amount of copies that customers need. 

Luis’s biggest dream is to has his own house someday so he can offer to his family the commodity and protection they need, that’s the reason he started his business and has worked in it so much, because he´s a committed and responsible man, so if you want to help Luis to fulfill his goals, a loan will do a lot of good.

loans.use: buy a big photocopier for his office supplies and stationary shop

loans.name: Romario

texts.es:
Romario es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad de la pesca en lorica, tiene dos hermosas hijas de 4 años y 5 meses de edad, las cuales ama y busca el mejor futuro para ellas.

Romario hoy se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico, la razón se remonta a un problema general con la ciénaga que se secó, afectando su profesión por un periodo de tiempo, hoy volvió a su normalidad y se está reponiendo de las perdidas y alistando su material para la pesca.

Por ello Romario con el apoyo económico comprara Nylon y plomo para fabricar las redes necesarias para la pesca, espera su ayudara para reponerse de lo que ocasionó la sequía.
texts.en:
Romario is 25 years old and is a father. He earns a living fishing in Lorica, he has two beautiful daughters, one is 4 years old and one is 5 months. He loves them and is looking for a better future for them.

Romario is now asking for financial help, the reason goes back to a general problem with the swamp as it dried up. This affected his profession for a period of time. Now it is back to normal and he is making up for the losses and preparing his fishing materials.

Therefore, with this financial help, he will buy nylon and lead to make the necessary nets for fishing, he hopes it will help to make up for what the drought caused.

loans.use: to buy nylon and lead to make the necessary nets for fishing.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 24-year-old single woman who lives with her mother. She started a small grocery store in her house on a wooden table and requests 2,000 EGP  rice, oil, and biscuits to generate income for her mother and herself.

loans.use: to buy  rice, oil and biscuits.

loans.name: Mujeres Prudentes Group

texts.en:
Angélica, 26 years old and single, is a model of the Guatemalan woman who, with limited education,has not been impeded in her drive to excel in her family and community. She has availed herself of every opportunity to succeed..She lives with her aging parents who try to help but are limited in being able to provide for their expenses.They all are fortunate to live in a community filled with natural beauty.

Five years ago, Angélica started her business selling sandals for women and girls in her town’s local market place. In order to achieve a higher income, she increased her inventory and sold the shoes by the dozen, as well as selling a variety of other shoe types. Now, she is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors so that she can increase her shoe inventory with new designs. She needs a larger inventory to sell at the upcoming village fair. 

Angélica is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Mujeres Prudentes Group who are very grateful to both Friendship Bridge and the Kiva investors for having confidence in them to grow their businesses through increased inventories. They are especially grateful for the fact that with the financial support they do not have to scrounge for income to support their families. The women like the monthly training they receive in important topics like business management, customer service, money investment, as well as health improvement – their own and their children’s.  Learning how to invest wisely has helped them stay in the market place. The women are very happy to be a part of Friendship Bridge and want to continue to grow their businesses and their knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase the latest shoe styles and meet  her customers' demands.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old and she is single, without children.  She is living with her parents at their home in Palomar.

 Betty sells milk and works many hours.  She needs a loan to buy a milking cow Betty has experience dealing with farm animals so she hopes you can trust her she also helps her parents

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to help her and her parents

loans.name: Catalinas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Catalinas” is in the quaint and picturesque town of Santa Catarina Palopo that is located on the shores of Lake Atitlan.  The women’s businesses are creatomg tradicional textiles and handicrafts.  After successfully and responsibly completing a second loan cycle, they are now requesting a third loan cycle so that they can continue to maintain and even grow their businesses.   

Marta, who is 32 years of age, is a member of the “Catarinas”.   She is single and like so many single women in Guatemala, she is responsable to financially support her family.  She does this with her business of making traditional textiles and handicrafts.  She also buys and sells textiles.  Marta is asking for a new loan in order to buy a variety of different colorful threads to enhance and diversify her inventory.

Marta is very happy to be a part of the “Catarinas”  since they all speak Kakchiquel and are illiterate.   The Trust Bank Facilitator conducts the monthly meetings in Kakchiquel  which puts Marta and her friends at ease.   This is important since the Facilitator also provides trainings in a variety of important topics that the women can use in their daily lives.  Topics like self-esteem, women’s and children’s health, as well as bookkeeping, accounting, customer service and idebtedness are a part of the Friendship Bridge’s “Microcredit Plus” combination of micro-loans and non-formal education that has become a win-win combination in the development and empowerment of the “Catarinas”.

Thank you,.Kiva investors, for being an integral part of this process!!!

loans.use: buy a variety of different colorful threads to enhance and diversify her traditional clothing inventory

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma availed the financial assistancefrom Paglaum MPC. As a farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her vegetable production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Thelma feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to her business. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next growing season. Thelma wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a farmer from Molave. She supports her family doing this type of work. She learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance gives. Josefa tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She loaned an amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income a big boost. Josefa looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda owns a snack vending store. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her store. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, butter, oil and margarine for her snack vending business. She is adding an extension store in a nearby barangay (village), and she wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, butter, oil and margarine

location.town: Tangub - Bongabong, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvie is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Elvie has a general store business in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvie has been in this business for 5 years. Elvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married to a farmer and has seven children between the ages of 17 and 25 years old, they attend school. She has sold alcohol for 20 years and will  use the loan to buy alcohol and enlarge her business.  The profits will be used to pay her children's school fees..

loans.use: to buy alcohol.

loans.name: Straton

texts.en:
Straton has three school-aged children who are between the ages of 7-13 years old. He and his wife sell sugar, rice, soap, and posho and have run this shop for seven years. 

Straton would like a loan in order to expand his business and use the profits to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and posho.

loans.name: Termbere Group

texts.en: Terimbere is a group led by Anastasie who is 45 years old. The group name means "vision” in English. She is married with seven children ages 6 to 20 years. She has a shop and has been in business for the past 15 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, Anastasie would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanis

texts.es: Un proyecto ambicioso es el que tiene en manos la señora Yolandis quien se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino. Hablando un poco de ella Yolandis es una mujer de 26 años de edad madre de un hijo y que busca con el apoyo de un préstamo la puntada final de su plan de reestructuración y remodelación de cocheras de cerdos, lo que busca es tener instalaciones en óptimas condiciones de calidad, con bebederos, comederos, también lo que busca es ampliar la existencias de animales por lo que la mitad del préstamo serpa destinado a una cerda de cría y lechones.
texts.en: Yolanis earns a living rearing pigs and she has an ambitious plan in sight. Speaking a little about her, she is a 26 year old woman who has one child. With the support of a loan she is looking to finish off her plan of restructuring and remodelling her pig sheds. She is looking to have facilities in optimum conditions of quality, with drinking and eating facilities. She also wants to increase her number of animals and so half of the loan will be used for a breeding pig and piglets.

loans.use: to have facilities in optimum conditions of quality with drinking and eating facilities.

loans.name: Orlando Miguel

texts.en:
Orlando is 51 years old and is from a small town called Chinú, where he lives with his partner, their two sons and one daughter. His children are really important to him and are the number one reason why he works so hard, 7 days a week, 12 hours a day.

Orlando has been working for many years in his cattle raising business, where he specializes in pigs. He has a wish of getting his business bigger and increasing his client base, which is why he needs a loan that will allow him to buy five piglets, fatten them up, and from there push forward with his work.
He dreams that someday he will be able to give to his children a good education that helps them to be successful in life and that maybe someday he will be able to open more establishments so his business grows and becomes more widely recognized. His dreams can come true with a little help. You can lend and make Orlando closer to his goals.

loans.use: to buy five piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  install sewer lines in her home.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can getl financial assistance for her chosen business. Evelyn has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, she took a loan to pay for seedlings and compost for her chosen business. Evelyn wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Virgielita

texts.en:
Virgielita is a businesswoman from Clarin Settlement, Oroquieta. She is 51 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Virgielita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with condiments, confectionery, canned goods and other consumables.

Virgielita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the ardent passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with condiments, confectionery, canned goods and other consumables.

loans.name: Shelmith

texts.en:
Shelmith is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn  is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn  is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has an internet café business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her internet business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old and she is married with 5 children aged 14 and 25 years. Two go to school. She is a farmer and he has been in a business for the past 8 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve family welfare and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is a mother with four children between the ages of 7 and 16, they attend school. Her husband is a motorcyclist and Clementine has sold local beer on a retail scale for eight years and enjoys her business. Clementine would like to buy green bananas to make the local beer.  She will save the profits.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is a 44-year-old woman with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 18. Her husband is a farmer. 

Sophie has sold shoes for 5 years and would like to buy  alcohol to sell.  She will use the profits to renovate her house and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy alcohol.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a 42-year-old single mother with six children between the ages of 7 and 21 years old. They attend school. 

She has sold beer for 18 years and will use the profits to pay school fees for her children and buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie aged 43 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 17 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. While her husband is a business man. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is a taxi driver from Gyumri town. He lives there with his father, wife and two children. 
Hovhannes drives a taxi both in GYumri town and outside and the income he gathers is vital for family's living. 

The requested loan is for the car to purchase 4 tires and pay for renovation of the car gear box. Because of this problems, Hovhannes is currently unable to drive his taxi. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 4 tires and renovation of his taxi gear box

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en: Mansour is a 50-year-old married man with 4 sons and 1 daughter. Two of his sons are married and live in separate houses. He raises livestock and uses the milk, cheese, and butter domestically and to sell. Mansour requests 10,000 EGP to buy lambs and goats and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy lambs and goats.

loans.name: Pativaine

texts.en:
Pativaine is a 47-year-old married woman with 8 children. 

She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas. She has been doing this for 6 years. Pativaine needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009 and will use the profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 30-year-old single woman with 1 child. She has sold mince pies for 1 year and needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, seasoning salt, a large frying pan, a spatula, and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Elena has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, seasoning salt, a large frying pan, a spatula and a new oven.

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en:
Faasulu is a 47-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a house painting business and a drives a taxi to earn an income. She has 9 years experience in this business. 

Faasulu needs a loan to buy barrels of paint, rollers, a new vehicle, gloves, overalls, boots, and new tires. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Faasulu joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy barrels of paint, rollers, a new vehicle, gloves, overalls, boots, and new tires.

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Teofista has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Teofista wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
From Sindangan, Marietta earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. 

To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell. Marietta hopes to live comfortably with her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for sale such as pants, undergarments, and shirts

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves for selling. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tea leaves for selling

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora makes good earnings with her farming activities in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school.

Leonora wants to increase her farm yield especially since she has a high cost of living since her children entered college. Leonora approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to pay workers for land preparation and to purchase fertilizers. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay workers for land preparation and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Retailing helped Fely survive for the family, knowing that she is the only bread winner in her family after her husband died. She sells basic commodities and drinks which are accessible to her neighbors and brings her a meager income of PHP 8,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling basic commodities is in high demand because it covers basic household needs.

Fely plans to expand her retail business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks and other items for retail.

loans.use: to purchase stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a married woman and describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, mattresses and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, mattresses and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved livelihood. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, mattresses and other items

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, eggs, candies, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and has a daughter who is 17 years old. She lives in Sabaneta and owns a beauty salon where she’s visited by many clients that admire and appreciate her work. Ruth is well prepared for her work since she has taken classes that have helped her to provide a high quality service.

Ruth wants to see her business grow and become a successful salon, where she can offer not only her services but many beauty products that allow her to improve her profits and increase her clients, that’s why she´s asking for a loan so she can buy beauty products for body care and inputs for her job like shampoos and haircutting tools.
One of Ruth’s biggest dreams is to pay for her daughter’s education so she can be a professional and make a great life for herself and that one day she can buy a house for her family so they can be comfortable and protected. A little help can give Ruth what she needs to start building her dreams.

loans.use: buy beauty products for body care and inputs for her job like shampoo and hair cutting tools

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 37-year-old married man with 3 children. He has a small grocery store and successfully repaid a 5000 EGP loan. 

He requests 6,000 EGP to buy oil, rice, and pasta to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Ngan Gnuni  Lam – Dobinofong Group

texts.en:
Abibata is a 45-year-old mother of four children living in Lamashegu, a community in the northern region of Ghana. Abibata is a member of a rice-processing group called "Ngan Gnuni Lam-Dobinofong." She is the person seated with her hand raised in the group photo.
