Abibata and her group have been in the rice-processing business for more than eight years now with a reputation for quality local rice. The group has requested a loan amount of 22,600 GHS. 

Abibata’s share of the loan is 800 GHS, which she would use to buy paddy rice from local farmers for processing to meet an increased demand of the home market. Abibata and her group consider meeting the demand a great opportunity to earn more income to pay back this loan and support their business and families.  

Abibata and Ngan Gnuni Lam-Dobinofong group are grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from local farmers for processing to meet an increased demand of the home market.

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
Tufa is a 31-year-old  married woman with 5 children who has sold elei printed material  for 1 year. 

Tufa requests a loan to buy rolls of material, brushes, rollers, wooden designs, stencils, and gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, brushes, rollers, wooden designs, stencils, and gloves.

loans.name: Taeina

texts.en: Taeina is a 33-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Taeina needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taeina has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Siaulaina

texts.en:
Siaulaina is 43 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for ten years. Siaulaina needs a loan to buy a new truck for transporting her produce to the town market, a sprayer, chemicals and more crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Siaulaina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new truck for transporting her produce to the town market, a sprayer, chemicals and more crops

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is a 32-year-old woman who is single with no children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has been in this business for four years. Iuni needs a loan to buy a new gear box, shocks, new taxi sign indicator, floor mats, and new tires. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Iuni joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new gear box, shocks, new taxi sign indicator, floor mats, and new tires

loans.name: Malae

texts.en:
Malae is a 68-years old  married woman with 10 children. She has sold elei printed material for 5 years and requests a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her famiy's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra continúa con su actividad de venta de comida. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de muebles para su puesto de venta de comida. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Actualmente ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de enfermería en 4 año de 5 que dura la carrera. Disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los síntomas de alguna enfermedad, su carácter es de servicio. Su principal necesidad en este momento son los instrumentos quirúrgicos para la especialidad de instrumentadora médica, “continúo con mi venta de comida, estoy terminando de estudiar y necesito algunos materiales que son un poco caros y difíciles de encontrar…” Comenta. La ventaja de sus ocupaciones es que los horarios no se cruzan ente sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de estudio. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar para trabajar en un centro médico, ella desea realizar la compra de materiales quirúrgicos para finalizar sus estudios de enfermería. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandra solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales quirúrgicos para finalizar sus estudios de enfermería y trabajar en un hospital.
texts.en: Alejandra continues with her business selling food. She invested the loan she previously obtained in buying furniture for her food stall. Her payment dues were paid on time because she did not have any problems. She is currently studying to be a nurse. She is in her fourth year of a five year degree. She likes to help people, she likes to understand the symptoms of an illness, her character is service oriented. Her main need right now is the specialty surgical instruments needed for a medical nurse. "I continue selling food, I am finishing studying and I need some materials that are a bit expensive and hard to find..." she says. The advantage of her occupations is that her schedules don't conflict. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy surgical materials. Her dream is to finish her studies so that she can work in a medical center. She wants to purchase surgical materials to finish her nursing studies. This is her second loan with this institution in the four years she has performed both activities. For these reasons Alejandra is requesting a loan to buy surgical materials to complete her nursing studies and work in a hospital.

loans.use: to buy surgical materials to complete her nursing studies and work in a hospital.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 62 years old. She is known in the Bongabong, Tangub City area for her snack vending store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. 

It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

location.town: Tangub - Bongabong, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing to caring and harvesting and earning income as well. 

Elizabeth has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Elizabeth has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Elizabeth hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, 38 years old, is known in the Sindangan area for her sari-sari (convenience) store. She actively participates in the various programs and services that PMPC offers. Gemma has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and wood because she hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like plywood, nails and pay for labor cost

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Floriana is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Floriana has a general store business in the Philippines. Floriana requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Floriana has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Floriana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, butter, etc., for her business.

Lydia has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, butter, etc., for her business

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine aged 37 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in a business for the past 5 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for rearing. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 7 years, one of them goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her family welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Muriel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Muriel es una dulce, trabajadora, adorable abuelita de 67 años de edad, toda una guerrera y campeona de la vida que no desiste de su trabajo solo pro el deseo de colaborar y tener sus propios recursos.

Muriel tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual inicio en el año 2006 y ha servido para su mantenimiento.

Ahora esta mujer quiere más, su pensamiento y sus ganas de progreso la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para tener una cría de cerdos y pollos, paralelo a su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Muriel is a sweet, hardworking, adorable granny who is 67 years old. She is a warrior and life champion who has not stopped working with the sole purpose of helping out and having her own resources. Muriel has a grocery store which she opened in 2006, and which is her source of income. Now this woman wants more: her thoughts and wishes of progressing have made her request a loan to start a business raising pigs and chickens, besides having her grocery store.

loans.use: to have a business raising pigs and chickens, besides having her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 47 años es soltera y vive en la ciudad de México tiene una carrera técnica como secretaria ejecutiva, ella trabaja en una empresa como secretaria además de tener un negocio de productos de belleza y calzado por catálogo, ella lo inicio porque en su empresa tiene varias compañeras, quienes se han vuelto sus clientas, ella ya lleva dos años en este negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 7,000 , con el cual podrá comprar un volumen grande de zapatos y cosméticos debido a que vio estos productos en oferta, le motiva tener un negocio más formal y poder establecerlo de tal forma que pueda ser independiente económicamente, ella tiene mucha esperanza en este préstamo y pretende solventarlo para poder adquirir prestamos posteriormente.
texts.en:
Dolores is 47, single, and lives in Mexico City. She has a technical degree as an Executive Secretary. She works in a company as a secretary in addition to having a business of beauty products and footwear from a catalog. She started this because in her company she has many friends who have become her customers. She has already had this business for two years. 

She is seeking a loan of MXN 7,000. With it she will be able to buy a large amount of shoes and cosmetics as they are on sale. This motivates her to have a more formal business and to be able to establish it in such a way that she can be economically independent. She has great hope in this loan and expects to settle it to be able to obtain subsequent loans.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of shoes and cosmetics as they are on sale.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en: Nickson lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 28 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children of ages ranging from one to eight years. He operates a retail shop, mainly buying and selling general merchandise, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and many others. He intends to grow and expand his business the more only to be limited by high rental fees and defaulting customers. He will use the loan facility to buy more shop items like salt, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shop items like salt, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for 4 years now.

Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gloria Astrid

texts.en:
Gloria is a 41 years old woman who has a daughter that is 14 years old. She is a single mother but she has made through life with a fighter soul and a positive spirit that has helped to give to her daughter everything that she needs.

Gloria sells food that she makes herself to different customers that love the way she cooks. She inherited her talent from her mother, who taught her everything that she knows. She was successful in starting her business and now she wants to improve it, by increasing her profits and by offering a more diverse menu to more customers. 

This is the reason Gloria is asking for a loan, so she can buy different ingredients to prepare new recipes.
Gloria has a lot of dreams that she hopes will someday come true. She dreams about having a house for her family and about the possibility of giving her daughter the best education she can, so one day she can grow up to be a professional. Gloria is determined to fulfill her dreams but with this little help, she will be closer to achieving it.

loans.use: buy different ingredients to prepare new recipes

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve aged 46 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 21 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. While her husband is a business man. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар, 56 лет, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Чынар среднее образование, уже 24 года она занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Чынар есть земельный участок мерою 1,8 Га, где она выращивает перец и клевер для реализации. Также есть 2 коровы, лошадь и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход Чынар составляет в среднем 11,000 сомов (KGS). Чынар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит скот для увеличения поголовья, часть средств направит на полеводство. Доходы от кредита позволят Чынар увеличить ее хозяйство и приобрести автомобиль для ее семьи.
texts.en: Chynar is 56 years old and married. Her children are grown up and independent. Chynar has a secondary education. She has been growing crops and rearing animals for 24 years. Today Chynar has a 1.8 hectare plot of land where she grows peppers and clover for sale. She also has two cows, a horse and ten sheep. Chynar's monthly income averages 11,000 som (KGS). Chynar has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with which she will buy livestock to increase her herd. She will use part of the funds for growing crops. The proceeds of the loan will enable Chynar to increase her farm and acquire a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase her herd and to cultivate her land for growing crops.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo “kuña kyre’y” está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se han puesto como meta mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo unido y con sus esfuerzos poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Catalina, una de las integrantes, pide este préstamo para  la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de asaditos y luego venderlas ya sea: carne, carbón, vegetal, sal condimentada y otros, ya que ella se dedica a vender comidas que ella misma hace y luego sale a vender.
Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group “kuña kyre’y” is in its 4th loan with this program of women's committees. These women have set a goal to improve their lives by working together and with their efforts to give their families everything they could not have. 

Mrs. Catalina, one of its members, is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to make grilled skewers such as meat, coal, vegetables, seasoned salt and others. Her business is selling food she makes herself and then goes out to sell. 

She is thankful for the opportunity that they receive to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, coal, vegetables, seasoned salt an others to make grilled skewers and then sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), tiene 3 años de experiencia en en el cultivo e inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su abuela, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para asistir sus cultivos y así seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face is pixelated as he is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area, earns a living by sowing staple crops (corn and beans). He has 3 years of experience in farming and he started with his own funds. He sells his products around the area where he lives. 

The young man lives in his own house with his grandmother. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilisers to help his crops and to continue with his work so he can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers to help his crops.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Курбонгул. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Курбонгул добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду 7 года назад и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело.
 Курбонгул проживает в районе Джоми с матерью, сестрой и племянникам.  К сожалению, её муж в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи – он на заработках в Российской Федерации. В швейном деле Курбонгул нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми людьми. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и приобрести много клиентов. Старая машинка устарела и не выполняет свои функции хорошо. Ее мечта - в будущем открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды.
texts.en:
This is Kurbongul. She is a tailor who makes Tajik female costumes. She works from home and she finds it convenient. Kurbongul is a kind and quick woman who is good at what she does. She learned how to sew and tailor female clothes seven years ago and has been in this business ever since.

Kurbongul lives in Jomi with her mother, sister and nephew. Unfortunately, her husband is currently far away from the family - he is working abroad in Russia. Kurbongul likes working as a tailor because she enjoys having income and interacting with clients on a daily basis. She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine, improve her working processes and increase her client base. Her old sewing machine is too old and does not function properly. Her dream is to open her own Tajik female costume salon.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Las Surgidoras De Horacio Zevallos Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos” conformada por 06 socias entusiastas que en el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado que son personas responsables. Ella es milagros una de las socias de 43 años de edad, separada con 5 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al cuidado infantil  desde hace 5 años. Su mayor deseo es poder terminar de construir su casa. Su crédito lo destinará para la compra de cemento y ladrillos para que pueda terminar de construir su casa. El grupo “las surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Milagros es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo color anaranjado y pantalón a cuadros.
texts.en:
This is the group "Las Surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos” which is made up of 6 enthusiastic members who, over time, have shown they are responsible people. 

One of the members is Milagros, who is 43 years old and is separated with 5 dependent children. She has worked in childcare for 5 years. Her greatest wish is to be able to finish building her house. Her loan will be used to buy cement and bricks so that she can finish building her house. 

The group "Las Surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos" is grateful to the people from Kiva who make this loan possible as it allows them to keep improving. Milagros is the second on the left and is wearing an orange t-shirt and checked trousers.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to be able to finish building their house.

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is 54 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maria Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria Liza requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Maria Liza has been in this business for five years. Maria Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is 39 years and married with six children, four attending school. Josephat deals in a cassava flour business and earns additional income from farming, working 14 hours a day and seven days a week. He is a hard-working and honest man whose dream is having all his children educated. However, he faces a challenge of market competition and limited capital. Josephat is requesting a loan to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is a 42-year-old, hard working married woman who takes care of one child, age 17. She deals in a silver fish commonly known as “mukene” and her income is supplemented by operating a restaurant and a bar that mainly sells beers and sodas. She has hopes of expanding her business despite the challenge of high transportation costs. She is seeking a loan to buy more silver fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more silver fish to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 59 years old and married with four children.

Marcelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marcelina has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marcelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fanny Margarita

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer de 59 años de edad, una mujer nacida y criada en el campo, que aprendió de la cría, levante, engorde de pollos y cerdos gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres y ahora quiere transmitirles su conocimiento a sus 6 hijos para que continúen con el negocio familiar.

Fanny ha tenido ayuda de los préstamo para crecer es por ello que cuando tiene una necesidad acude a ellos, como ahora que busca aumentar su cantidad de animales para vender más, no se puede dejar vencer de la competencia, su sueño es ver su negocio crecer y mantenerse en el tiempo.


Fanny quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos de engorde, alimentos, vacunas, adecuaciones del galpón para hacerlo fuerte contra lluvias y compra de una cerda de cría.
texts.en:
Fanny is a woman of 59, a woman who was born and raised in the country, where she learned to raise, fatten, and produce chickens and pigs, thanks to the teachings of her parents. Now she wants to transmit her knowledge to her six children so that they can continue with the family business.

Fanny has had help from the loans to grow [her business]. It is for that reason that when she has a need, she turns to them, as [she is doing] now that she is seeking to increase her quantity of animals in order to sell more. She cannot let herself be defeated by the competition. Her dream is to see her business grow and be sustained.

Fanny wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of chickens to raise, feed, and vaccines; to make adaptations to the chicken shed to make it stronger against the rain; and to buy  a pig to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise, feed, and vaccines; to make adaptations to the chicken coop to make to stronger against rain; and to buy a pig to raise.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de negocios, trabajadora y apasionada tiene 45 años es casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene una licenciatura en química y trabajó en una empresa por más de  10 años. Con el fin de ofrecer las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, ella ha creado una empresa  en la cual ya lleva tres años, ella vende productos químicos para la industria automotriz. A ella le gustaría expandirse a otras regiones para ser la empresa más reconocida en el país. El crédito que solicita es para comprar productos en grandes cantidades y poder aumentar sus ventas. El sueño de Martha es ser estable financieramente y poder brindarles estudios de calidad a sus hijos. Con este préstamo será capaz de aumentar los ingresos en su empresa, este ya es su segundo préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en:
Martha is a hardworking, passionate, business woman. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She has a bachelor's degree in chemistry and has worked in a company for more than 10 years. With the purpose of offering then best living conditions to her family, she has crated a company that has been operating for 3 years, where she sells chemical products for the auto industry. She would like to expand to other regions to be the most popular company in the country. 

The loan she is requesting is to purchase products in bulk and increase her sales. Martha's dream is to be financially stable and be able to give her children a good quality education. With the loan she will be able to increase her company's earnings. 

This would be her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: She is requesting a loan to purchase products in bulk quantities and be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is 55 years old and single with 12 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. 

She needs a loan to buy a new display cooler, a new weighing scale, rods, drinks, frozen goods, fresh veggies and accessories. 

Sela hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display cooler, a new weighing scale, rods, drinks, frozen goods, fresh veggies and accessories

loans.name: Omeka

texts.en: Omeka is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has seven years of experience with this business. Omeka needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Omeka has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Florecitas” (Little Flowers) is located in the town of Nahualá in the Western Highlands of Guatemala.  The group is made up of eight hardworking women who, for the most part, make typical wrap-around skirts (cortes) in dark colors which are then contrasted by the bright colors - reds, whites, blues, purples, and maroons -  of their beautiful blouses (huipiles).  The eight women are extremely happy with the growth of their small businesses, due in part to the loans provided by KIVA investors. 

Sixty-three-year-old Manuela is a member of  “Florecitas” who never had an opportunity for a formal education.  She knows the value of having one.  In order to provide an education, food, and clothing for her eight children, she began a business of making typical wrap-around skirts (cortes) to sell in her community.  Her business now has four workers.  Manuela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a quantity of thread and yarn in lots of colors and textures. She wants to have plenty of inventory on hand  to meet the demand of her customers and increase her profits. 

Manuela and her friends in the Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings when a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares useful information with them on a variety of subjects. They learn about the world around them and within them as they hear about effective business practices, health and nutrition, as well as self-esteem and empowerment. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. It is most effective.
 
The eight women of “Florecitas” send their infinite gratitude to the KIVA investors for supporting women’s businesses in their world and helping them to change their communities.  Mil gracias (thank you)!!!

loans.use: To buy a quantity of thread and yarn in lots of colors and textures.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Ферузе 27 лет. Она семейная женщина. Феруза проживает на районе Спитамен. Муж находится на заработках  загранице, он каждый месяц отправляет деньги домой.  Свекровь пенсионерка. Она занимается земледелием около 8 лет. Феруза арендует 2 Га земельный участок возле дома. Она на поле выращивает картофель, помидоры, пшеницу и рис.    Феруза любить заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Ей больше нравится домашние животные, и она решила заниматься животноводством. Феруза с детства мечта иметь скота во дворе. Она планирует взять кредит и покупать скота для нового бизнеса. Вы можете поддержать ее достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Feruza is 27 years old. She is married. She lives in Spitamen. Her husband is earning money abroad. He sends money home every month. Her mother-in-law is retired. Feruza has been cultivating land for eight years. She rents a 2ha plot of land next to her house. She grows potatoes, tomatoes, wheat and rice.  She loves working the land but she also likes livestock breeding. Since childhood she dreamed of owning cattle. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy cattle. You can support Feruza in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business

loans.name: Dadojon

texts.ru: Дадочон семейный человек. Ему 45 лет. Он живет в городе Худжанд. Отцу 75 лет.Маме 73 года. Жене 43 года. Дадочон образованный, умный, честный человек. Он занимается сварщиком. Дадочон освоил эту профессию, когда находился на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сейчас он продвигает свою работу уже 10 лет. Он соединяет металлических частей путем сварочный аппарат. Дадочон хочет приобрести новый современный сварочный аппарат и его другие принадлежности и расширить деятельность. Для купли необходимый средств у него нет денег, и он решил обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Dadojon, 45, is a family man who lives in Khujand. His father is 75, his mother is 73 and his wife is 43 years old. Dadojon is an educated, intelligent and honest man who works as a welder. He learned this trade when he was working in Russia. He has been working in this field for ten years. Dadojon would like to purchase a new, modern welding machine to get more work. Since he does not have the money for it, he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and get more work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to continue improving the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.en:
Maria Gloria works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Maria Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosebie

texts.en:
Rosebie is a 49-year-old married mother of four children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosebie has a buy-and-sell footwear business in the Philippines. Rosebie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more footwear to sell to her customers.

Rosebie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosebie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more footware to sell to her customers

loans.name: Asayati

texts.en: Asayati lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 28 years old and married with four children, ages 6 to 11. She operates a beauty salon mainly for women and sells cosmetics and synthetic fibers. She supplements her incomes by raising goats. She dreams of growing and expanding her business as well as educating her children. She is seeking a loan to buy more braids and lotions to sell.

loans.use: to buy more braids and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yhon Fabio

texts.es:
Fabio un hombre con 21 años de edad, casado, trabajador y humilde que busca diariamente los medios por el cual conseguir los recursos básicos para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

No tiene un trabajo estable, sobrevive por medio de trabajos ocasionales, lo cual le genera pocos ingresos, el pide un préstamo con el cual comprara un soldador de alto costo, que le permita realizar mejor sus labores como lo son arreglos de  electrodomésticos y construcción.

Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su casa y brindarle a su esposa un mejor calidad de vida.
Aporte al sueño de Fabio, haga un préstamo.
texts.en: Fabio is a 21 year old man. He is married, hardworking and humble; every day looking for the means to get basic resources to pay for his household's necessities. He does not have a stable job; he survives thanks to occasional jobs which generate small earnings. He is requesting a loan to buy a high cost welding machine which will allow him to improve his work duties, such as repairing appliances and in construction. He dreams of improving the condition of his house and of giving his wife a better quality of life. Give to Fabio's dream; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine of high cost, which will allow him to improve his work duties, such as repairing appliances and in construction.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 31 год, замужем, 3 детей школьного возраста. У нее средне-специальное образование, с 2006 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Жазгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 40 овец. На 2,40 Га земли она выращивает клевер, картофель и перец. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности Жазгул составляет около 23,000 сом (KGS). Жазгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и завершение строительства дома. Доходы от кредита позволят Жазгул развить ее бизнес, и достроить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Zhazgul, 31, is married and has three school-age children. She has a high school diploma and has been making her living from agriculture since 2006. Through her hard work, she owns four cows and forty sheep. She grows clover, potatoes and peppers on a 2.4ha plot of land. Her monthly profit amounts to about 23,000 som (KGS). She is requesting a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy more livestock and build her house. She is planning to reinvest the money and finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd and to finish the building of her house

loans.name: Raihan

texts.ru: Райхан, 57 лет, замужем, многодетная счастливая мама 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи 30 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Райхан на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и удобрений для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Райхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Raihan, 57, is married. She is a happy mother of four children. She has a high school degree and earns her living by breeding livestock and cultivating land. She has been doing it for thirty years. Through her hard work, she owns two cows. Today her business brings a profit of 20,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) per month. Hoping to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy additional livestock and fertilizers. She plans to reinvest the profit.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd and to purchase fertilizers for land cultivation

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en: Sothea is 40 years old and lives in a remote area of the Battambang province. She has three children with only one in school. She has grown corn and cassava to support her family for the last 10 years. She faces some challenges such as lacking water to support her cash crop and the fluctuation in market prices of crops, forcing her to sell at a lower price. She doesn't have enough money to support her child’s education so she decided to take out a Kiva loan to fulfill her needs. For Sothea, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is going to use her loan to pay for her child's school fees. She hopes that this loan will help her child have a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand trousers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials and merchandise to sell (bookstore).

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su cónyugue en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Oswaldo se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de más ganado vacuno, para su engorde y posterior venta. Con esto Oswaldo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 50 years old, he lives with his spouse in a rural zone in the Pucara district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly earn a living from agriculture, livestock and trading. 

Oswaldo earns a living from livestock and selling cattle, his business operates from his own home. He has 20 years of experience in this business, and has good personal and working references in the area. 

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy more cattle, to fatten them and later sell them. With this Oswaldo hopes to offer a better product to his clients, which will allow him to generate more income and eventually increase the quality of life for his family and himself.

loans.use: to purchase more lviestock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 39 year old unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Nancy needs a loan to buy a new frying pan, a new oven, a strainer, yeast and bags of sugar. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Nancy has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new frying pan, a new oven, a strainer, yeast and bags of sugar

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 31 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Mary Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, cereals, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, cereals, biscuits, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, cereals, biscuits, and detergent soap to sell.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona is single and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Melitona requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

Melitona has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Melitona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
. .
Susana has a sewing business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Susana has been in this business for five years. Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell firewood and charcoal business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, of Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to buy construction materials to complete constructing building her school. She still owns the school where she earns a living, although she also carries out farming where she especially raises livestock to earn extra income. She started the business to improve her standard of living. She still faces a hardship of delayed payment of school dues by the parents; however, she hopes to expand her school and improve pupil enrollment in the near future.

Rose is requesting a loan to buy more construction materials to improve the school structures.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to improve the school structures.

loans.name: Mary Gorreti

texts.en: Mary Gorreti used the previous loan to rehabilitate her banana plantation. She is also a dairy farmer rearing cows for milk production and producing waragi.(local brew.) She faces challenges of long distances to access veterinary doctors to treat his animals. This leads to increased death of the animals. However, she is working very hard to have a big piece of land for her animals. Mary Gorreti needs a loan to buy roofing materials like iron sheets and nails for her house construction.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials like iron sheets and nails for her house construction.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est une femme veuve qui habite le quartier d’Adidogomé. Agée 55 ans, elle a trois enfants à sa charge et ménage assez d’efforts pour couvrir leurs diverses préoccupations. Pour gagner sa vie et réaliser une rentabilité, Amivi vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique et arrive à assurer les charges. Amivi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de riz,  des bidons d’huile et des paquets de couche pour alimenter sa boutique, Amivi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et maximiser son profit pour aider ses enfants.
texts.en: Amivi is a widowed woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is 55 years old and has three children living under her care. She works very hard to meet their various needs. In order to earn a living and make a profit, Amivi sells general foodstuffs in her shop and is able to make ends meet. She gets her supplies three times per month from market. Amivi is requesting this loan in order to purchase five bags of rice, three bottles of oil and five packs of diapers so she can maximize her profits. By doing this, she will be able to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of rice, three bottles of oil and five packs of diapers

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive  junto a sus dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad en casa propia y humilde. Ana es una madre muy responsable que a diario lucha para poder  ganar el sustento diario de sus hijos  por lo que se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina, los cuales ofrece a los vecinos y en los alrededores de su comunidad todas las tardes, es así como ella gana los ingresos económicos que cubren las necesidades básicas de su hogar, además Ana es una persona bastante altruista y amable que ha puesto a disposición su casa a la comunidad para que se impartan clases a jóvenes que no saben leer. Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para encementar el piso  del corredor de su casa porque por el momento es de tierra y en época seca origina abundante polvo que afecta su salud con las enfermedades respiratorias. Con el crédito ella  comprará: cemento, grava, arena y pagara mano de obra.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old, she is a single mother and lives with her 2 children of 16 and 18 years old in her own, humble house.

Ana is a very responsible mother that struggles every day to be able to earn enough to support her children. She earns a living selling chicken tamales, which she offers to her neighbours within her community every evening. Through this she earns the economic income which covers the basic needs of her home.

Ana is a nice and unselfish person, and she has made her house available to the community to give classes to children who do not know how to read.

Ana is asking for  FUSAI loan to cement the passageway floor outside her house because at the moment it is just soil, and during the dry season a lot of dust is created which causes health problems due to respiratory diseases. With the loan she will buy cement, gravel, sand, and pay for the labour.

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel, sand and to pay for the labour to cement the passageway floor outside her home.

loans.name: Dolly Cristavel

texts.es: Dolly de 38 años vive con su esposo, ella es madre de dos niños de 13 y 7 años por quienes lucha día con día junto a su esposo para sacarlos adelante y que tangan una buena educación. Dolly  veía la necesidad de salir a trabajar pero no quería dejar al cuidado de otras personas a su pequeño hijo, pero con esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su esposo estableció un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende productos de primera necesidad en su comunidad gracias a este aporta también ingresos económicos a su hogar y no tiene que dejar solos a sus hijos. Ella está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: arroz, frijol, azúcar, galletas, refrescos, sopas, café, papel higiénico, huevos, aceite etc., para mejorar su negocio y tener más variedad  y a la ves obtener más ganancias de su negocio y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Dolly is 38 years old and lives with her husband. She is a mother of two children who are 13 and 7. She fights for them every day along with her husband in order to get them ahead in life and so that they can have a good education. Dolly saw the need to work but she did not want to leave the care of her young son to another person. But with effort and with the help of her husband she set up a small business in her home where she sells basic products in her community. Thanks to this she also contributes to the household income and she does not have to leave her children alone. She is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, soups, coffee, toilet paper, eggs, oil, etc. to improve her business and have a wider variety and at the same time earn more from her business and continue improving the life of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, soups, coffee, toilet paper, eggs, oil, etc. to improve her business.

loans.name: Dúo Génesis Group

texts.es: Dúo Génesis Elvia María de 36 años, es madre de 4 niños menores de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas Y a la venta de verduras. Elvia junto a su familia lucha cada día por seguir adelante y le agradece a FAPE KIVA la ayuda que se le brinda. Elvia María  nuevamente solicita un nuevo crédito para la inversión de su negocio pues menciona que comprando por mayor obtiene una mejor ganancia.  Elvia María tiene ahora como meta comprar un automóvil para el traslado de su verdura y espera muy pronto hacer su meta una realidad, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y verduras para la venta.
texts.en: Elvia Maria of Duo Genesis is thirty-six and the mother of four small children. She works selling tortillas and vegetables. Along with her family, Elvia strives to succeed every day, and she is grateful for the help of FAPE KIVA. Elvia Maria is requesting a new loan to invest in her business; she mentions that by buying at wholesale her earnings are higher. Elvia Maria's current goal is to buy a car for transporting vegetables, and she helps to make this goal a reality very soon. Right now she is soliciting a loan to buy corn and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: purchase corn and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 37 years old and married with four children. With all of her children currently in school, Merlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merlinda has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, soft drinks, beer, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Myrna has been in this business for four years now.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tatiana Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela una joven con 20 años  de edad, que se dedica su mayor tiempo a la cría de aves, un negocio que hasta ahora depende ella y sus dos hijos menores.

Debido al espacio y condición en que se encuentra el galpón Marcela busca un préstamo el cual le ayude a renovar el lugar y comprar pollos, espera obtener mayores crías, y con esto buenas ganancias.

Su mayor sueño es el de comprar una vivienda en la que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida.

Marcela al igual que varios micro-empresarios esperan la ayuda de usted, haga un  préstamo.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 20 year old young woman, who spends most of her time to raising birds, a business which she and her two young children have relied upon until now.

Due to the space and condition of her shed, Marcela is looking for a loan which would help her to renovate it and buy chickens, she hopes to obtain more offspring and with this better earnings. 

Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a home in which her children will have a better quality of life. 

Marcela expects from you as well as several micro entrepreneurs to help her and make a loan.

loans.use: to renovate her chicken pen and buy chickens, she hopes to get more offspring and with this make good earnings.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 59-year-old widow with three children. She makes and sells Samoan chips in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Eseta needs a loan to buy a barrel of cooking oil, new woks, a large oven, a strainer and seasoning salt. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Eseta has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of cooking oil, new woks, a large oven, a strainer and seasoning salt.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 39-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. One of these children attends nursery school. He is a teacher, which helps him earn a living. He earns additional income from a retail shop and agriculture. He hopes to be self-sufficient and educate all his children although he is limited by bad debtors in his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like iron sheets and cement for his residential house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like iron sheets and cement for his residential house.

loans.name: German Andres

texts.es:
Andrés un joven con 21 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, con disposición para trabajar, siempre dedicado a su familia conformada por su madre, su padre y un hijo menor, siempre se esfuerza por buscar los medios para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Desea abrir su primer negocio de comidas, pero como no cuenta con un buen capital solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara un carro adecuado para esta labor, alimentos y desechables.

Su sueño es segur trabajando, formalizar su negocio y comprar una vivienda.
Usted puede aportar a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Andres is a 21 year old youth, he is hard working and humble, with a willingness to work. He always dedicates himself to his family, made of of his mother and father and a younger brother. He always strives to find the means to cover the needs of his home. 

He wishes to oper his own food business, but because he doesn't have good capital he is asking for a loan, with which he will buy a suitable car for this, food and disposable plates and cutlery. 

His dream is to be able carry on working, create his own business and buy a home. You can support his dream by offering a loan.

loans.use: to buy a suitable car for his work,  as well as food, and disposable plates and cutlery.

loans.name: Dúo Eva Group

texts.es: Dúo Eva, integrado y representado por la señora, Elva, casada tiene dos hijos quienes ya estudian, su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario en un local dentro del mercado Municipal de Santiago sac, doña elva también tiene una venta de consumo diario en su casa y  un puesto de venta de pastas y flores en las afueras del mercado de Santiago, desde hace ya doce años, está feliz pues a incrementado sus ventas y con eso sus ganancias, ella vende golosinas, gaseosas, frijol, maíz, azúcar y otros productos de consumo, su deseo es ayudar a su esposo a mejorar su vivienda con sus ganancias y ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles(consumo diario)para vender.
texts.en:
Dúo Eva is made up of and represented by Elva, who is married and has two children who already study, whilst her husband earns a living selling daily consumable products in a local market in Santiago. 

Elva also has a business selling daily consumables in her house and one which selling pastries and flowers in the outskirts of the Santiago market. For 12 years she has been happy to be increasing her sales and therefore earnings. 

She sells candy, soft drinks, beans, corn, sugar and other consumables, her wish is to be able to help her husband to improve their home with their earnings and help their children to carry on studying. She is asking for a loan to purchase daily consumable products in order to sell them.

loans.use: to buy daily consumable products to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for water storage for domestic use

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of spare parts business in the Philippines.

Ofelia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of spare parts to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ofelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette aged 28 years, is married with 2 children aged 2 and 5 years. Not yet in school. She is a farmer and she has been in a business for the past 4 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees of her children and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a 47 years old married man with 8 children and all of his children are currently attending schools. He lives in rural setting with his family. He deals in agriculture majorly grows coffee and passion fruits to support his family and he supplements his income with a taxi which he drives in the evening after farming. He works six days a week on his gardens and each day he works for 7 hours.

He started his business in 1996 with the aim of getting money to support his family as its demands were becoming endless. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fertilizers, passion seeds and herbicides for his plantations.

His clients are traders from capital city and his dream is to accumulate wealth for his children education but his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital, pests and diseases, climatic and price changes for agricultural products which are not stable.
He describes himself as a hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as organic fertilizers, passion fruit seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the workers who cultivated her maize.

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai is 44 years old and married with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years.

Sivai needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new shovels, a wheelbarrow and boots. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Sivai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new shovels, a wheelbarrow and boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build her room which is made of thin metal sheets at the moment.

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yobana ella es soltera y tiene 27 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de cabina de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "QORICCOYLLOR", which is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province.

The partner is Mrs Yobana, she is single and is 27 years old. The partner works selling grains, such as wheat, maize and quinoa. She works from 8am until 5pm, and already has 4 years of experience in the business which is going well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell grains. Mrs Yobana is asking for a loan to purchase wheat, maize and quinoa. 

The other partners earns a living from a restaurant business, an internet cafe business, a grocery store and selling animals.

The partner is grateful to those who help her achieve her dreams and she promises to comply with the fees payment within the set time limit.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize and quinoa.

loans.name: Aywayro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal AYWAYRO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maras, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Margarita, continua dedicándose al  negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de chicha, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales menores entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the AYWAYRO communal bank, which is located in the Maras district, Urabamba province in the Cusco area. 

The partner Margarita continues to earn a living from her business raising young animals, she is a responsible and persevering person. She continues to raise her animals in order to later sell them to her clients, she also sells a maize liquor which is how she helps her family move forward. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase young animals. The member are grateful for the loan they received and promise to comply with the payment dates.

loans.use: to buy young animals amongst other things.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of purchase order cards business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell for her buying and selling of purchase order cards business.

Victoria has been in this business for seven years. Victoria earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Guiado por su deseo de tener su propio cultivo, el señor Francisco inicio su cultivo de plátano a penas con conocimientos empíricos y buscando tener mejores ingresos que ayudaran a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su pareja e hijo.

Con sonrisa, con ganas de trabajar, con conocimientos empíricos se lanzó al emprendimiento esperando obtener resultados gratificantes, hoy casi 40 años después de aquel atrevimiento Francisco goza de tener una abundante terreno con palos de Plátano y no se detiene, quiere más, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y pagar la asistencia de cultivo, busca ampliar lo que hace 40 años inicio y dejarle un excelente legado a su hijo.


El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abonos, riegos.
texts.en:
Guided by his desire of having his own crop, Francisco began growing bananas. He started with little empirical knowledge and the aim of having a better income that would help him improve the quality of life of his family, which consists of his partner and their son.

With a smile, an eagerness to work, and empirical knowledge, he embarked on this venture, hoping to obtain gratifying results. Today, almost 40 years after taking that risk, Francisco is the proud owner of a plot of land with an abundance of banana trees.

Francisco doesn't want to stop there. He wants more. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs—such as seeds, fertilizers, and an irrigation system—and to pay for labor to help with his crop.

He wants to expand what he started 40 years ago and leave an excellent legacy to his son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor to help with his crop.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is 48 years old and married with 2 children. 
She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for 7 years. Lesina needs a loan to buy a new engine for her pick-up that is used for moving her produce, a new chainsaw, chemicals, and new wheelbarrows. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2004. Lesina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her pick-up that is used for moving her produce, a new chainsaw, chemicals, and new wheelbarrows

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en:
Lesa is 21 years old and single with one child.
 
She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Lesa needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Lesa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Sauiluma

texts.en: Sauiluma is a 29-year-old single woman with 1 child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Sauiluma needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, a large cooler, foam cups, Chinese red candy, jugs and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to support her family and her child. Sauiluma has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, a large cooler, foam cups, Chinese red candy, jugs and plastic bags

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en: Mouena is a 48-year-old widow with 2 children. She makes and sells fish and chips in her community, and has 1 year of experience with this business. Mouena needs a loan to buy a new gas oven, a gas tank, 10 large bags of frozen fries and a large barrel of vegetable oil. She plans to use her profits to cater to her family's every need. Mouena has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new gas oven, a gas tank, 10 large bags of frozen fries and a large barrel of vegetable oil

loans.name: Dúo El Carmen Group

texts.es: Dúo El Carmen: este grupo esta conformado por la señora Alejandra de 49 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para seguir con su negocio de venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Dúo El Carmen: this group is made up of Alejandra, a 49 year old woman who earns a living making and selling tortillas, she has done this for many years. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase maize, to be able to carry on with her business selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy maize in order to make tortillas to sell

location.town: Comunidad Carmen del Monte, Barcenas, Villa Nueva

loans.name: Yesenia Dolores

texts.es: Yesenia de 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia a lado de su esposo  y sus tres hijos de 12 y 6 años y un bebe de 6 meses de edad.  Yesenia  diariamente se dedica a realizar  servicios varios como conserje  en una escuela cercana a su comunidad,  es de esta forma es como ella gana para el sustento de su familia, además su compañero de vida para aportar a la economía de su familia labora en una compañía aledaña a su comunidad para de esta manera junto a su esposa sacar a sus hijos adelante con sus estudios. Yesenia con el propósito de mejorar su condición de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para terminar de comprar los materiales que necesita para la construcción  de  un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda, con el monto otorgado  podrá invertir en arena, grava, cemento y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación.
texts.en:
Yesenja is 31 years old, and lives in her own house together with her husband and three children of 12 and 6 years old, and a 6 month old baby. 

She earns a daily living carrying out services such as being a caretaker in a local school, from this she earns enough to sustain her family. Also her husband works in a neighbouring company  in order to support their family, together they help their children to move forward with their studies. 

With the intent of improving their quality of life, Yesenia is asking for a FUSAI loan to purchase the materials which she need to construct a bedroom in her home, with the loan she will invest in gravel, cement and will pay for the labour to construct a bedroom.

loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel and to pay for labour to construct her bedroom.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 56 years old and married with three children. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, etc., to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. 

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 43-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in buying tomato gardens and harvesting tomatoes, which he sells in the market. He started this business with a hope of increasing his family income. 

Julius needs a loan to rent tomato gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent tomato gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim used his previous loan to buy stocks of clothes to sell. He started his clothing sales business with a hope of earning an income. Ibrahim is also involved in farming, growing bananas and maize for commercial purposes. He faces challenges of competition that hinder expansion of his business. Ibrahim needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: Celia a sus 53 años de edad es una señora muy trabajadora, se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, con el crédito que le va a otorgar  nuestra institución va a comprar chanchos para mejorar su negocio, su esposo trabaja en la cuadrilla (personas que se reúnen diariamente en lugar esperando que llegue alguien y les de trabajo), Celia comenta que aunque sus negocios sean pequeños ella les saca el mejor provecho posible, Celia tiene 6 hijos y desea incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y que su hija de 16 años siga adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en: Celia, 53, is a very hardworking woman.  She is engaged in raising small animals and, with the loan provided to her by our institution, she will improve her business by purchasing pigs.  Her husband is part of a work crew that meets every day at the same place waiting for someone to put them to work.  Celia says that although her businesses are small, she is getting the best profit possible.  She has six children and wishes to increase her business so that she can improve her income, and her 16 year old daughter can continue her studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Sialatua

texts.en:
Sialatua is a 54-year-old, unmarried woman with six children. She makes and sells ice-cakes and locally made chips in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Sialatua needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Sialatua has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Malili

texts.en: Malili, 50 years old, is unmarried and has 7 children. For the past 4 years, she has owned and operated a small flea market, selling a variety of items. Malili needs a loan to buy rolls of printed material, a box of shoes, Samoan-made kava bowls, fine mats and woven fans. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. Malili became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy rolls of printed material, shoes, Samoan-made kava bowls, fine mats and woven fans

loans.name: Losalia

texts.en: Losalia is a 65-year-old mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei (fabric printing) materials at the market. Losalia requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paints, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village. Losalia became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paints, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in oil, beans, cheese, gas, pork, etc., in order to generate more income to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.name: Guadalupe Group
