texts.es: La Sra. Felicitas tiene 56 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Marden quien es docente en una institución educativa particular y con quien tiene 5 hijos pero solo 1 depende aun de ellos. Felicitas es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Guadalupe” conformada por 5 mujeres muy responsables que decidieron agruparse para trabajar y salir adelante juntas. Ella tiene como fuente de trabajo la venta de comidas al paso (salchipapas, hamburguesas, parrilladas, etc) que ella misma prepara en casa, así de esta forma ayuda en la economía del hogar. El préstamo lo utilizara en comprar su herramienta de trabajo (carrito sanguchero) para que pueda preparar mejor y más rápido sus comidas al paso para sus clientes. Uno de sus anhelos es implementar su propio restaurante en casa donde ella misma prepararía sus deliciosas comidas. En la foto grupal Felicitas se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 56 years old and is married to Marden who is a teacher in a private school. They have five children together but only one is still dependent on them. Felicitas is the president of the "Guadalupe" communal bank which is made up of five very responsible women who decided to get together to work and get ahead.

Her source of income is selling fast food like salchipapas (sausage potato dish), hamburgers, barbeque, etc. that she makes in her home. In this way she helps with the household economy. She will use the loan to buy a working tool (a food cart) where she can prepare her food better and faster for her customers. One of her dreams is to open her own restaurant in her house where she can prepare her delicious foods. In the group photo Felicitas is standing in the middle of her seated companions.

loans.use: to buy her work tool (a food cart).

loans.name: Kawayida

texts.en:
Kawayida is a married man with 12 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells cocoa only and does not have any additional side income for his family. 

Seasonality changes lead to low cocoa output, thus affecting his income and standard of living, but he is a hardworking man. 

He needs a loan to buy more cocoa to sell, and his dream is to expand his business in future.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and pay school fees.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Su nombre es Paulino, vive en la localidad rural de Cocachacra junto a su adorada esposa y su menor hijo. Paulino se dedica a la cría de animales de granja y también a la agricultura, el apuesta por la agricultura orgánica, queriendo ofrecer lo mejor para su familia y sus clientes. El requiere apoyo para poder comprar semilla orgánica de ajo y poder sembrarlo en su terreno agrícola. En el futuro espera poder darle a su familia estabilidad económica y sobre todo darles lo mejor natural y orgánico para conservar mejor la salud de sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Our member, Paulino, lives in a rural part of Cocachacra with his wife and young son.  He has a farm where he grows organic crops and raises farm animals for sale.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to plant organic garlic and says that he wants to deliver a good, safe product to his customers.  He wants to provide a strong financial footing for his family and give them the same good, safe foods that his customers demand.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Luaono

texts.en: Luaono is 53 years old and has 6 children. She is a Samoan citizen who runs a small business selling pancakes in her community. Luaono requested a loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a fry pan and wooden spoons to run the business. She has been selling pancakes for more than 2 years and hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a fry pan and wooden spoons

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a 31-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Mareta requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda es una joven muy trabajadora. Ella es maestra de educación primaria y da clases en san Martin Jilotepeque y por las tardes se dedica  a la venta de ropa típica como lo son: cortes, güipiles, fajas y perrajes, estos productos tienen mucha demanda en esa área. Sus pagos los a realizados puntualmente. Ella está muy feliz por su bebita que acaba de nacer y quiere trabajar mucho para darle todo lo mejor. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes, güipiles y fajas así surtirá más su negocio y ganara más. Y sus pagos los realizo sin ningún día de atraso. Agradece a Fape y Kiva el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en: Irma Yolanda is a hard-working young woman.  She teaches at the elementary school in San Martin Jilotepeque during the morning and runs her clothing sales business in the afternoon.  She sells traditional clothing, much in demand here: cortes, güipiles, fajas y perrajes.  She has a new baby and is working hard to give her the best of everything.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the clothing that she sells.  The investment will give her more merchandise to sell and increase her earnings.  She will also be able to repay the loan without delay.  She is grateful, she adds, for the support she has received from FAPE and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Carlos Patricio

texts.es: Patricio es un señor trabajador, tiene su negocio que es el de comercializar productos como papas, zanahoria, habas, mellocos entre otros, Patricio adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, Patricio solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de papas zanahoria y otros productos, Patricio vive con su madre, 3 hermanos y 4 sobrinos, Patricio comenta que tiene 10 años en su negocio y que su experiencia hace que este sea rentable, además Patricio manifiesta que su negocio es de suerte ya que los precios de los productos suben o bajan a diario, Patricio  espera mejorar su negocio y de esta manera lograr seguir trabajando en su negocio para mas adelante comprarse un vehículo que le permita transportar su  mercadería y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos del hogar, sobre todo a su madre que ya esta viejita.
texts.en:
Patricio is a hard worker. He owns his own business selling products like potatoes, carrots, beans, and other root vegetables, amoung others. He works in agriculture. He is requesting a loan to invest in potatoes, carrots and other products.

Patricio lives with his mother, three siblings and four nephews. Patricio has ten years of experience in this business and his experience makes it profitable. Patricio maintains that his business depends on luck, given that prices rise and fall daily.

Patrick hopes to improve his business to be able to continue working in that business. He wants to later buy a vehicle that allows him to transport goods and thus continue to support his family in household expenses, especially his mother who is getting on in years.

loans.use: buy potatoes, carrots and more.

loans.name: Taupaolo

texts.en:
Taupaolo is a 43-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Taupaolo has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also help expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material

loans.name: Tagivale

texts.en:
Tagivale is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Tagivale needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to better her family's living conditions. Tagivale has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, and soft drinks

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en:
Itagia, a 45-year-old married mother of four, has owned and operated a small flea market selling a variety of items for three years. Itagia needs a loan to buy shoes, shirts, shorts, handicrafts, fine mats and woven fans. 

Itagia became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, shorts, handicrafts, fine mats and woven fans

loans.name: Valaauina

texts.en: Valaauina is 41 years old and has 4 children. She has run a business providing houses for rent for more than 2 years. Valaauina requested a loan to buy cement, timber, paints and paint brushes to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and to provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy cement, timber, paint and paint brushes

loans.name: Elsa Maryna

texts.es: Elsa de 54 años de edad vive con su esposo, su hija y una nieta de 4 años de edad que es la alegría del hogar. Elsa para obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia  tiene una pequeña venta de productos de primera necesidad en su casa hay una nieta a quien ella ayuda, pues la madre de la pequeña sale a trabajar y llega  la casa al tiempo a dejarle un pequeño aporte para la niña, con lo que ella gana de la tienda que posee abastece las necesidades básicas de su hogar y las de la niña, también elabora a mano bolsones de hilo, y hamacas, el cual es el oficio que ella quiere aumentar. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: hilo de colores, para la elaboración de hamacas y bolsones de esta manera aumentar más los ingresos de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su nieta.
texts.en: Elsa, 54, lives with her husband, her daughter and--the light of their lives--her four-year old granddaughter.  Elsa has a small retail business selling the everyday products that local buyers need.  Elsa helps to support her granddaughter and the business provides an extra income for the family.  She also has a separate business making and selling hammocks and bags, a business that she would like to develop and grow.  She is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to buy different colors of thread for making hammocks and bags.  The investment will help her to grow her new business and, in turn, provide a better quality of life for her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her hammock- & bags-making business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela tiene 31 años es casada y vive en San Luis Potosí, estudio una carrera técnica en enfermería, tiene un hijo pequeño quien depende de ella, cuando su hijo nació sufrió de muchas enfermedades por lo cual tuvo que dejar su trabajo como enfermera razón por la cual tuvo que dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella presagia un mejor futuro, lleva más de un año dedicándose a esto, además tiene la meta de iniciarse en el negocio de bienes y raíces. Solicita un préstamo de MXN 10,000 para poder comprar más productos, porque en esta temporada ella los adquiere al 50 %, con esto pretende formar su propio grupo de 11 personas para ser directora de ventas. Su mayor sueño es tener casa propia y lograr una independencia económica, en su tiempo libre gusta de hacer ejercicio.
texts.en: Graciela is 31 years old, married and lives in San Luis Potosí, She studied to be a nurse and she has a young son who is dependent on her. When her son was born he had many illnesses and she had to leave her job as a nurse. This is the reason she started to sell beauty products by catalog in which she felt she had a better future. She has been doing this for more than a year and she also has a goal of starting in the real estate business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 MXN to be able to buy more products as at this time she can buy them at half price which she wants to use to form a group of eleven people with her as the director of sales. Her big dream is to own her own house and achieve economic independence. In her spare time she likes to exercise.

loans.use: to have a larger stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Aguas Calientes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUAS CALIENTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These group members belong to the community bank  “AGUAS CALIENTES” (Hot Waters); This bank is located in the district of Challabamba, in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco.

One of the group members is Juana, who is 32 years old, single, and has 3 children.  She works at her business selling cereals.  She sells corn, wheat and quinoa.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She's been doing this for 4 years and it's going very well.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the cereals.  She is requesting this loan to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The group member who is pictured apart from the others was photographed after the group meeting because she asked permission due to her work.

The other group members work at businesses including: animal sales, cereal sales, grocery store, and food sales.

They are grateful to all who form a part of this dream through this medium and promise to complete their payments at the scheduled times.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Yuri Marcela

texts.es:
Yuri es una mujer de 32 años de edad, que con esfuerzo, sudor, sueños, monto un negocio de salón de belleza, negocio que empezó por necesidad económica, buscando un mejro futuro para los integrantes de su hogar, su pareja e hijo de 11 años de edad.

Yuri desea tener un negocio que se asemeje a lo que pretende de salón de belleza, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos como tinturas y tratamientos y el resto capital será para la remodelación de su puesto de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yuri is a 32-year-old woman, that with effort, sweat, and dreams started a beauty salon business.  She began this business for economic necessity, looking for a better future for the members of her home, her partner and 11-year-old son.  

Yuri wants to have a business that resembles the beauty salon it claims to be.  For this she is requesting a loan for the purchase of products like dyes and treatments.  The rest of the capital will be used for the remodeling of her place of work.

loans.use: to buy products such as dyes and treatments, and the rest of the capital will be used for the remodeling of her place of work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cordial, jugs, large bags of sugar, a large spoon, cooking oil, and a pop-corn maker

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 63 years old with 8 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Elisapeta requested a loan to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow,  gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and a chainsaw  to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2003, and hopes to use her  profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow,  gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and a chainsaw

loans.name: Silvia Raquel

texts.es: Silvia de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando con su apoyo, ya que ella desea que puedan optar a una mejor calidad de vida. Silvia se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de pan dulce por las tardes y en las mañanas recorre las calles de su municipio para ofrecer prendas de vestir para caballero, damas y niños, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Silvia desea invertir en su mercadería, ya que cada día cuenta con una mayor cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, blusas, camisetas, pantalones cortos, vestidos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Silvia, 36 years old, lives in her own home together with her husband and her 4 children who are 18, 16, 12, and 8. Her children are in school with her support because she desires that they will be able to aim for a better quality of life.

Silvia has earned a living for 6 years selling sweet bread in the afternoons, and in the mornings she travels the streets of her area to sell articles of clothing for men, women, and children. This is what allows her to obtain a better income. 

Silvia wants to invest in her merchandise because every day she has a larger number of customers who want her products. For this reason she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in skirts, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and dresses, among other products.

loans.use: to invest in skirts, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and dresses, among other products.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive is a 65-year-old mother with 7 children. For over a year, she has owned and operated a small business selling elei (fabric printing) materials at the market. She is still strong in running the business with her children's help. Nive requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paints, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village. Nive became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paints, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine

loans.name: Gardenia

texts.en:
Gardenia is a 22-year-old, unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Gardenia needs a loan to buy jugs, cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups and a chest freezer. She plans to use her profits to take care of her baby. 

Gardenia has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy jugs, cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups and a chest freezer

loans.name: Dúo Los Claveles De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo los Claveles de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora María Sandra, quien se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, short de tela.  Su sueño es tener una tienda y tener en  venta todas las prendas que confeccionan. Tiene varios pedidos de pantalones en diferentes tallas y colores pero los rollos de tela que tiene no le alcanza y necesita comprar más.   Necesita otro préstamo para comprar la tela que le hace falta y  poder terminar la ropa que le han pedido.
texts.en: María Sandra is the manager of the “Dúo los Claveles de Vista Hermosa” Communal Bank. She is engaged in sewing clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, and fabric shorts.  Her dream is to own a shop where she can sell all of the clothing that she sews.  She has various orders for pants in different sizes and colors, but she doesn’t have enough rolls of fabric and needs to buy more.  She is requesting another loan to purchase the fabric she needs, which will enable her to finish the clothing her customers have ordered.

loans.use: to purchase material for sewing clothing.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Maliam

texts.en:
Maliam is 36 years. She is married with one child who is 4 years old and he goes to school. She sells food stuffs and she has been in a business for the past 5 years. While her husband is a business man. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for selling. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and renovate her house. In future she wishes to become a whole seller.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Dúo Las Flores De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Duo las flores de Villa Nueva. 
Doña Mónica  empezó su negocio hace cinco años los cuales le han servido para tener una mejor experiencia en la ventas y con cliente ella empezó vendiendo  una carga de leña y luego su negocio fue incrementando ella agradece a Dios y a sus padres por la oportunidad que le han brindad y a fape por  la oportunidad de un nuevo crédito, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de leña para la venta.
texts.en: Group Duo flowers Villa Nueva. Monica started her business five years ago which has helped her experience better sales and customers. She began by selling a load of wood and then her business began to increase. She thanks God and her parents for the opportunity they have given her. She also thanks field partner FAPE for the opportunity of a new loan. She is requesting this loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a farm and has been involved in this business for 3 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and fertilizers. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large scale business. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs such as plants and fertilizers

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius used the previous loan to buy a lawn mowing machine for compound cutting. He has a motorcycle business alongside the compound mowing business. He dreams of buying a car, constructing rentals, and expanding his business to new areas. Julius needs a loan to  buy another lawn mowing machine for compound cutting.

loans.use: to buy another lawn mowing machine for compound cutting

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 23 года, замужем, есть годовалый сын. Образование высшее, она работает в школе учителем. Также занимается сельским хозяйством. У Айнагул есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади, на 0,28 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 38,000 сом (KGS). Айнагул решила развить свое дело и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для отгона на выпас на пастбище. Доходы от кредита Айнагул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий за счет покупки мебели.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 23 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. She has a post-secondary education, and she works as a teacher in a school. She also does agricultural work. Ainagul has 2 cows, 10 sheep, and 2 horses, and raises barley on 0.28 hectares of her own land and 1.0 hectares of rented land. Her monthly income is about 38,000 som (KGS).

Ainagul has decided to expand her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a horse to put to pasture. Ainagul will invest the proceeds from her loan in the further expansion of her business, and in the improvement of her living conditions by purchasing furniture.

loans.use: to buy one horse to put to pasture.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Donald es uno de muchos jóvenes que deciden moverse de sus ciudades para venir a vivir a la capital buscando un mejor futuro. A sus 23 años de edad, estudia la licenciatura de Mercadeo y publicidad, una carrera que le ha gustado siempre, con la que denota pasión en cada proyecto universitario que hace. 
Donald cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y de su cuñado, quienes trabajan en una empresa privada del país. Su espíritu valiente y con grandes deseos de superación, lo han llevado a convertirse en uno de los mejores alumnos de su universidad. Él tiene grandes proyectos educativos en mente, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y así poder realizar sus tareas y proyectos sin ninguna barrera. En sus planes está que finalizando la carrera encontrar un empleo acorde a su licenciatura.
texts.en:
Donald is one of many young persons who decide to move from their cities to come live in the capital in search of a better future. Twenty-three years old, he is studying marketing and advertising, a career that he has always liked, for which he shows passion in every university project he does.

Donald has the support of his sister and his brother-in-law, who work in a private company of the country. His brave spirit, with great desires to excel, has led him to become one of the best students at his university. He has big educational projects in mind, for which he is applying for a loan in order to buy a computer and thus be able to do his homework and projects without any obstacles. Among his plans for when he finishes his studies is to find employment commensurate with his degree.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Carlos Vicente

texts.es: Carlos vive con sus padres y una hermana, el es un joven soltero y muy trabajador, crecio en el campo donde casi todas las personas viven de la agricultura y la crianza de animales, Carlos  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, al jornal en la agricultura, también  siembra pequeños huertos de papas y otros productos que se dan por su residencia, Carlos necesita el  crédito para invertirlo  en la compra de productos agrícolas como la semilla de papa, abono, fungicidas, herbicidas y entre otros, Carlos tiene la mayor aspiración de seguir en su negocio,  mejorarlo  y en algún momento comprarse un  terreno para sembrar sus productos y no tener que pagar arriendo así como lo hace en la actualidad.
texts.en: Carlos is single and lives with his parents and a sister.  He is a hard-working young man who knows farming and animal-rearing because he grew up in this rural part of Ecuador where most people make their living from the land.  He raises farm animals now and works as a farm laborer.  He also rents a small plot of land where he grows potatoes and other garden crops.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies for his farming business: seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.  For the future, he hopes to buy land of his own so that he needn't carry on paying rent for the land he farms.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Wilikister

texts.en:
Wilikister is a married woman with 7 children. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 7 years and her business is located in a busy area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be an international maize supplier. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs to produce maize for sale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man, with 7 children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a farm where he grows tea and also keeps livestock and his business is located in a busy area. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs for the continued expansion of his farming activities

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, with 1 child. She describes herself to be dynamic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a large scale boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe is 25 years old, she owns a general store in which she sells home items such as cooking oil, maize floor, salt, rich and a few soft drinks. She has been doing this business for the past seven years.

With the profits she wishes to expand her business and to make some savings as well. Beathe’s dream is to become a wholesaler one day.

loans.use: to stock up on items such as cooking oil, maize floor, salt, rich and a few soft drinks.

loans.name: Eva Masiell

texts.es:
El sueño de Eva es empezar una pequeña empresa, razón necesaria para decidir estudiar Administración de empresas, pues considera que esa carrera le brindará las herramientas indispensables para cumplir con ese sueño. Ahora esta joven de 26 años de edad lleva el cuarto año y además trabaja como cajera en un banco desde hace seis meses. 
Eva considera que está en un mundo de oportunidades, donde no puede desaprovechar ninguna y debe estar preparada para todo. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una Tablet y así estar a la vanguardia con la tecnología para realizar sus investigaciones. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien también se encuentra emocionado de ver a su esposa cerca de cumplir su meta de obtener su título universitario.
texts.en:
Eva's dream is to start a small company. This is her reason for deciding to study Business Administration, and she believes that this degree will provide the indispensable tools to accomplish this dream. Now this 26 year old is in her fourth year [of university] and on top of that has worked as a teller in a bank for six months. 

Eva believes that this is a world of opportunities, where you can't waste anything and should be prepared for everything. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase a tablet to be on the cutting-edge with her technology to accomplish her studies. Fortunately she counts on the support of her husband, who also is excited to see his wife close to completing her goal of obtaining her degree.

loans.use: to purchase a tablet.

loans.name: Meleane

texts.en: Meleane is a 55-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small flea market in town. She has been in this business for three years. Meleane needs a loan to buy cava bowls, printed material, shoes, accessories and hangers. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Meleane joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cava bowls, printed material, shoes, accessories and hangers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 42 years old with 3 children. She runs a business selling taros and bananas at the market to earn a living. 

A loan amount of $1,500 WST will help Lilia to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, a backpack sprayer and hand gloves to help her run the business.

She hopes to expand her business using her profit and provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, a backpack sprayer and hand gloves

loans.name: Jolie

texts.en:
Jolie is 24 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. 

Jolie needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, Samoan carved earrings and jewelry. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, Samoan carved earrings and jewelry

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a 40-year-old woman who is single with 2 children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has two years with this business. 

Merina needs a loan to buy new tires, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, petrol and brake pads. 

She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Merina joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, petrol and brake pads

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 38-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Paula requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan to assist her in running the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to build small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old unmarried woman with 3 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Mary needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven and a new gas tank. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Mary has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven and a new gas tank

loans.name: Mayerli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mayerli es una mujer de 32 años de edad, una persona recursiva, inquieta, una mujer  que tiene la convicción y el entusiasmo de salir adelante. Ante la falta de oportunidades para emplearse Mayerli inicio un negocio de cría de aves con el que pudo solventar sus necesidades económicas pero encontró que solo le daba abasto para lo básico no generaba progreso, por ello invirtió en la compra de un fogón de carbón y comenzó a vender chorizos, gracias a estos dos negocios goza de una buena calidad de vida, sus dos hijas se encuentra estudiando, comen bien, tiene un techo donde vivir y se siente feliz de lograr tanto y ayudar en su hogar.

Para seguir con su progreso Mayerli quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de chorizos, pollos y alimento para pollos.
texts.en: Mayerli, a 32 year old woman, is a resourceful, restless woman that has the conviction and enthusiasm to get ahead.  Given the lack of employment opportunities, Mayerli started a business raising chickens, which enabled her to meet her economic needs, but she found that it only supplied her with the basics and didn’t generate progress.  For this reason, she invested in the purchase of a coal stove, and began selling sausages.  Thanks to these two businesses, she enjoys a good quality of life. Her two children are in school, they eat well, and have a roof over their heads. She feels happy to have achieved so much, and to be able to help in her home.  In order to continue making progress, Mayerli wishes to request a loan to purchase sausages, chickens, and chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase sausages, chickens, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Calca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ROSAS DE CALCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia ella es conviviente y tiene 24 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leña, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de verduras.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The participants belong to the communal bank "The Roses of Calca".  The bank is located in the District of Calca in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. 

Sra. Sofia is one of the members. She is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. She works in her business, which is a grocery store and restaurant.  She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  Through this business she wishes to become successful.  She is an enterprising and hard working woman.  Her dream is to increase the business at her store.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  The other group members engage in businesses such as selling firewood, selling food, managing a grocery store, and selling vegetables. 

Sofia is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Ada Erleis

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer de 42 años de edad que estuvo gran parte de su vida inmersa en el mundo de la confección, ahora que tiene una mentalidad diferente monto un negocio y busca triunfar sacando su línea propia de ropa, pero ella es humilde y no cuenta con capital para comprar los insumos para trabajar, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de motores nuevos para las maquinas que son más ahorradores de energía, compra telas y demás insumos. 

Su propósito es generar una excelente calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ada is a 42 year old woman who spent a large part of her life immersed in the world of tailoring.  Now she has a different mentality and has started her own business.  She hopes to succeed with her own clothing line.  She is not wealthy and doesn't have the capital to buy the supplies to work.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase new motors for the energy saving sewing machines, to purchase fabric and to purchase other supplies.  

Her goal is to earn an excellent living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new motors for the machines, fabric and supplies.

loans.name: Yorleny Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Yorleny es una mujer de 27 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y cuido para tres meses.

Su historia se remonta años atrás cuando partió con pareja y dos hijos a vivir juntos, desde entonces se las han arreglado para generar los recursos para sobrevivir, pero ella se cansó de no tener algo más por ello inicio con su negocio y está muy enfocada en comprar vivienda y darle una educación digna a sus muchachos, por tal razón acude a la comunidad kiva para que al apoyen en su labor y permitan el crecimiento de una empresaria que peleara por una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en: Yorleny, a 27 year old woman, is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and feed for three months.  Her story goes back to years ago when she left with her partner and two children to live together.  Since then, they have managed to generate the resources to survive, but she got tired of not having anything extra.  For this reason, she started her business and is very focused on buying a home and giving her children a decent education.  For this reason, she turned to the Kiva community for support in her work, which will permit her to grow as a businesswoman, and fight for a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed for a three month period.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Don Juan de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la cultivo de maíz desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Don Juan esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y puede tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 57 years old, and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been growing corn for the past 20 years, selling his products around the community. 

Don Juan is requesting a new loan to buy more seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, etc. and to improve the field shown in the picture. This way, he can continue working, which gives him a good profit, and he, together with his family, can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Hidelisa

texts.en:
Hidelisa is a member of NWTF and supports her family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Her son Benjie is 17 years old and is the first of the three children in the family. He is studying toward a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in his first year of this four-year course.

Hidelisa is borrowing PHP 6,300 to pay tuition fees of her son Benjie for the first semester of the school year 2015-16. Benjie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business selling purchase order cards in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Retailing helped Emelita survive for the family. She retails general merchandise such as condiments, confectioneries, and other items that bring in a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She has found the business of buying and selling general merchandise easy because these are common household needs.

Emelita plans to expand her retailing business. She applied to PMPC for a loan for the needed capital. She wants to purchase merchandise such as canned goods, condiments, coffee, milk, detergent, beauty soap, and shampoo for her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as canned goods, condiments, coffee, milk, detergent, beauty soap, and shampoo for her inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with three children. With her three children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, beers, bread, etc.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 21 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es una madre de 35 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 9 y 13 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez. Para Filomena su familia es lo más importante y para darles  lo mejor se dedica a la venta de granizadas desde hace dos años,  pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la elaboración de blusas, gracias a este pequeño negocio ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Filomena con el afán de mejorar su negocio de venta de granizadas ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder realizar una inversión en la compra de más frutas y poder ofrecerles a los clientes más sabores de granizadas.
El gran sueño de Filomena es poder construir una casa más grande para que su familia viva mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Filomena is a 35-year-old mother. She is married and has a beautiful family of three children between 9 and 13 years of age. This modest family lives in the community of Suchitepéquez. 

Family is the most important thing for Filomena. To give them the best, she has sold shaved ice drinks for the past two years. In order to improve her earnings she also makes blouses. Thanks to this small business, she has succeeded in meeting the basic needs of her children. 

Filomena, with a view to improving her shaved ice business, has decided to request a loan to allow her to invest in the purchase of more fruits and be able to offer more shaved ice flavors to her customers. Filomena's greatest dream is to be able to build a larger house so that her family can live much better.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for shaved ice drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas para la siembra de papas gracias al crédiro podra mejorar su situación econpmica, ella sueño que sus hijos sean profesionales, el desafio al que se enfrenta es la falta de oprtunidades, y en su tiempo libre le gusta pasearse con sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa is 28 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She works in agriculture and is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials to plant potatoes. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her financial situation. She dreams of her children graduating from college. The challenge she faces is a lack of opportunities. In her free time, she likes to go out and about with her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Yair Antonio

texts.es:
Buscando un mejor futuro para su familia el señor Yair inicio hace poco un negocio de cría de cerdos guiado por la necesidad económica y por la falta de oportunidades.

Con este trabajo planea mantener a su familia y a través de la formalidad, la constancia, el esfuerzo sacara su empresa adelante.

Yair quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer sus cocheras, como empezó hace poco no cuenta con mucho capital y está en etapa de adaptación al mercado, el dinero será destinado a la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Seeking a better future for his family,Yair started his pig raising business a short time ago. He was guided by financial necessity and a lack of opportunities.  

With this work, he plans on supporting his family and get his business ahead though trustworthiness, stability and hard work.

Yair wants to ask for a loan to stock his pig sties. Since he started a short time ago, he doesn't have a lot of capital and he is in the market adaptation phase. The money will be used to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is 34 years old and divorced with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. 

Easter needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods and cooking oil. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods and cooking oil

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is a 37-year-old mother with two children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. 

Fuatino requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a frying pan

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 38 years old with six children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Maima requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow,  hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer and a chainsaw to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow,  hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer and a chainsaw

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a 31-year-old single mother with two children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Mirama needs a loan to buy foam cups, cordials, bags of sugar, Kool Aid, Chinese candy, and a new freezer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Miriama has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cordials, bags of sugar, Kool Aid, Chinese candy, and a new freezer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victoria is 51 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Victoria has a sewing business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for five years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Isabel Patricia

texts.es:
Isabel es una joven campesina con 29 años de edad, madre de un menor, trabajadora, humilde y responsable, que desde niña aprendió a realizar todas las labores de campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.

Gracias a esto ha logrado un buen progreso, hoy en día posee variedad de cultivos, lo que le ha ayudado a generar ingresos para el sustento de su hijo.
Solicito un préstamo con el cual comprar un computador el cual le ayude a llevar el control de su negocio y así reducir tiempo realizando esta actividad a mano.

Su mayor sueño es el de brindarle a su hijo una buena educación y mejorar las condiciones de su casa, pero sabe que con el apoyo de interactuar lo lograra.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 29 year old farmer. She is the mother of a child and is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. 

Thanks to this, she has achieved good progress. Today she has a variety of crops, which has helped her generate income to support her child. 

She has asked for the loan to buy a computer which will help her to keep the books for her business, thus reducing the time needed to do this task by hand. 

Her biggest dream is to offer her son a good education and improve her living conditions. She knows that with the support of Interactuar, she will achieve it.

loans.use: to buy a computer which will help her keep the books in business and thus reduce the time doing this activity by hand.

loans.name: Seila

texts.en:
Seila is a 49-year-old widow with no children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. 

Seila needs a loan to buy Samoan T-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan T-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps

loans.name: Toreka

texts.en: Toreka is a 50-year-old mother with 5 children. She runs a business making bricks and selling them to earn a living. Toreka requested a loan to buy 40 bags of cement, sand, a shovel, and a wheelbarrow to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of cement, sand, a shovel, and a wheelbarrow to help her run her business.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is a 41-year-old mother, with six children. To earn a living, she runs a small business, selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Matauaina requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, backpack sprayer, and chainsaw, to help her run the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. Matauaina became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2005.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, backpack sprayer, and chainsaw.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is 43 years old and has four children. To earn a living, she operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community. She has been doing this for more than two years. Aliitasi requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Feng

texts.en:
Feng is 33 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years.

Feng has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and gloves.

loans.name: Totua

texts.en: Totua is a 57-year-old mother with three children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Totua requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro root (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is a 23-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Pepe needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven and a large pot. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Pepe has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven and a large pot.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 68 years old and widowed with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Diosdada has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing. Diosdada aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 30 years old and has two children. Ritchel is married and her two children are in school.

Ritchel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ritchel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ritchel has been raising livestock for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es: Isabel tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida de manera ambulatoria. Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios nuevos ollas platos y cubiertos. El grupo  DON BOSCO agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Isabel es que la que se encuentra adjuntada en la parte superior izquierda. Ya que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por atender su negocio
texts.en:
Isabel is 33 years old and is in a domestic partnership with 2 dependent children. She earns a living selling food as a street vendor. Before that she was dedicated to domestic duties. The loan will be invested in the purchase of new utensils, pots, plates, and silverware. Don Bosco Group gives thanks to the investors of Kiva for the provided loan. 

Isabel is the person attached in the upper left corner since she couldn't be present in the meeting due to attending her business.

loans.use: to purchase new utensils.

loans.name: Pologa

texts.en: Pologa is 62 years old with eight children. She runs a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Pologa requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012 and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer

loans.name: Anapenina

texts.en: Anapenina is a 29-year-old mother with two children. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Anapenina requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia is a 62-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Leonia requested a loan to buy a freezer, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than four years. She became a member of SPBD in 2005.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages and plastic bags.

loans.name: Faatutu

texts.en: Faatutu is a 39-year-old mother with five children. She operates a small business providing services to people by cutting grass to earn a living. Faatutu requested a loan to buy a lawn mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, safety boots and a safety uniform to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, safety boots and a safety uniform.

loans.name: Iupita

texts.en:
Iupita is 27 years old with two children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living.

Iupita requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and backpack sprayer to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

Elsa has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as already-formulated fertilizer and sulphate

loans.name: Rube

texts.en: Rube is 22 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Rube needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Alba Janete

texts.es: Alba, tiene 40 años de edad se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar, inicio vendiendo almuadas, cortinas, colchas, actualmente ya cuenta con dos empleados, y carro propio en el cual todas las mañanas sale a ofrecer sus productos, solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de licuadoras, planchas, colchas pabellones y vajillas para surtir más el negocio anhela tener un local propio para así tener más oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en: Alba, 40 years old, sells household products, she started by selling pillows, curtains, and bedspreads, currently she has two employees, and her own car in which every morning she goes out to offer her products. She’s applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of blenders, irons, bedspreads, canopies, and tableware to further stock the business. She yearns to have her own site to thus have more work opportunities.

loans.use: buy household products (for resale) .

loans.name: Faasao

texts.en: Faasao is a 33-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. Faasao requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast.

loans.name: Eduardo De Habich Group

texts.es: “EDUARDO DE HABICH” es un nuevo grupo conformado por socios jóvenes. Juan tiene 35 años de edad es soltero. El se dedica a prestar servicios de mototaxista con la moto que obtuvo hace muchos años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de repuesto para su moto. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Juan es el que se encuentra parado en medio.
texts.en:
“Eduardo de Habich” is a new group made up of young members.  Juan is 35 years old and is single.  He works at providing motorcycle taxi services with the motorcycle that he got many years ago.  

The loan will be invested in the purchase of replacement parts for his motorcycle.  The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan offered.  Juan is the one standing in the middle.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Dianna

texts.en:
Dianna is 33 years old with four children. She runs a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Dianna has requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Tiesi

texts.en:
Tiesi is 47 years old and unmarried with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years.

Tiesi needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, flour, a sack of onions, drinks, snacks, and stationery for children. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice, flour, a sack of onions, drinks, snacks, and stationery for children.

loans.name: Sulieti

texts.en:
Sulieti is 59 years old with nine children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Sulieti requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, and chainsaw to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2006, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, and chainsaw.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vivian is 34 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, fish, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Vivian has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, fish, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es una campesina de 55 años de edad, una persona del campo, pujante, trabajadora que ama su tierra, heredo los terrenos de sus padres y fue el quien le enseño todo lo que sabe, del campo depende su familia por ello mantenerlo es tan importante.

EL sueño de Rocio es dejarle un excelente legado a sus hijos, por tal razón se empeña en el mantenimiento y rotación de ventas.

Para mantener sus cultivos abonados, Rocio quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, riegos, semillas y pagara la asistencia técnica.
texts.en:
Rocio is a 55 year old farmer. She is from the countryside and is a vibrant and hard worker who loves her land. She inherited the land from her parents and they showed her all she knows. Her family depends on the land and that is why looking after it is so important.

Rocio's dream is to leave an excellent legacy for her children and for this reason she focuses on the upkeep and sales turnover.

In order to keep her crops fertilized, Rocio is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers, an irrigation system, seeds, and to pay for technical assistance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, an irrigation system, seeds, and to pay for technical assistance.

loans.name: Mabel Haydee

texts.es:
Mabel, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, dos de ellos trabajan para ayudarle con los gasto del hogar y el otro es menor de edad y está estudiando.

Mabel, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, aprendió está actividad ya que desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a sus padres con esta tarea, además de trabajar sus propios cultivos también vende ropa casa por casa en el cantón donde vive, todo para poder tener el sustento diario para su familia y para llegar hasta donde están sus cultivos tiene que caminar 2 kilómetros.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar abono, semilla y pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo cual estará mejorando sus ingresos, porque cultivará una nueva variedad de semilla para aumentar la produccion de granos.

Mabel, desea en un futuro poder tener sus propios terrenos para cultivarlos y que sus hijos puedan trabajarlos tambien.
texts.en:
Mabel has a second grade education, and she is the mother of three children, two of them work to help her with the household expenses, and the other is a minor who attends school. 

Mabel cultivates basic grains, and learned this activity when she was a little girl, helping her parents with this work.  In addition, to working her own crops, she also sells clothing door-to-door in the canton where she lives.  She does all of this to provide her family with daily sustenance, and to get to her crops as she has to walk two kilometers. 

She will use the loan to purchase manure, seeds, and pesticides for her corn and bean crops, and this will improve her income because she will cultivate a new variety of seed to increase grain production.  In the future, Mabel wishes to have her own lands to cultivate, and wants her children to be able to work them, also.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, and pesticides for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.en:
For Alvaro, his family is the most important thing in the world, and his job is the best way to give them everything that they need. He’s 39 years old and has two beautiful little children, a boy who is only five and a baby girl who is two years old. They live together in a town called Mariquita where he has his livestock raising business and he specializes in pigs.

He wants to boost up his business by stocking up to have more pigs to offer, so this way he will get more profits and his job will be more productive. That’s why he needs a loan so he can buy some piglets and food to fatten them up. With the increase of his profits he will invest in his business and in his family’s happiness.

Alvaro’s biggest dream is to get a house for his family to make them feel protected and comfortable, and he wants to pay for his children’s education, because he believes that by studying they can go really far in life and be successful.

loans.use: to buy some piglets and food to fatten them up.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 19 years old and single with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Dorothy needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Dorothy will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade.

loans.name: Lemapu

texts.en:
Lemapu is a 34-year-old, mother with two children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She has had this experience for more than a year. Lemapu has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and chemicals to help her to run the business. 

She will use her profits to expand her business and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD this year, 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and chemicals.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 46 years old and single. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Amalia has been farming vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Thelma has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tokusarona

texts.en:
Tokusarona is a 29-year-old unmarried woman with 2 children. She runs a very successful food stall at the town market and also owns a taxi to earn extra income. She has 10 years of experience with this business. 

Tokusarona needs a loan to purchase a new taxi, a large oven, bags of sugar, vanilla, baking soda and cordials. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Tokusarona has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase a new taxi, a large oven, bags of sugar, vanilla, baking soda and cordials

loans.name: Alaese

texts.en: Alaese is a Samoan citizen, and she is 29 years old with five children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She hopes to expand her business using her profits, but in order to do this, Alaese requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), and a backpack sprayer to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD this year, 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina is a 31-year-old married woman with 5 children. She runs a building completion and furnishing business and has been serving Samoa for more than four years. She has five years of experience with this business alongside her husband. 

Katrina has requested a loan to buy two large electric saws, decorating timber, varnish, nails of all sizes, carving tools, hammer and a cement machine. 

Katrina is one of our most innovative clients; she hopes to use her profits to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. 

Katrina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy two large electric saws, decorating timber, varnish, nails of all sizes, carving tools, hammer and a cement machine

loans.name: Aleta

texts.en:
Aleta is a 45-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has three years with this business.

Aleta needs a loan to buy a new taxi and pay for the registration fee and paint job. She will use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Aleta joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi and pay for the registration fee and paint job.

loans.name: Entsar

texts.en:
Entsar is a married woman from Dora, a small village near Hebron city. She is a mother for one son and one daughter. 

Most of Dora's citizens are very famous for raising cattle. Entsar has a barn for raising sheep. Her husband helps her sometimes in the barn. 

Entsar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 

Entsar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one small son. Three years ago, Mahmoud started his own business, which is a restaurant. He makes meals for wedding parties and other social events.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some cooking tools and a big oven for his business. This will increase his productivity and also his income. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some cooking tools and a big oven for his business

loans.name: Hector Jaime

texts.en:
Hector is a 34-year-old man who has a little boy who is just 4 years old. He used to work in different companies doing some jobs as a carpenter; this is  where he learned all that he knows about handling wood. Some time ago he decided that he wanted to start his own business and he did, so now he owns his carpenter place.

He has accomplished a lot of things by working really hard, and he intends to keep doing it. 

Right now he’s asking for a loan so he can buy wood and more tools so he can make more products to sell because he wants to increase his profits by offering more beautiful products and to get more clients.

He dreams with buying a house for all his family, so he puts a lot of effort and love to what he does because he’s positive about accomplishing all his dreams. You can help him to get close to what he wants by loaning the money he needs to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and more tools

loans.name: Mayra Jackelin

texts.es:
