Mayra, es madre de una niña que tiene un año de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que su familia es de escasos recursos, está acompañada y su pareja no vive con ella, porque él trabaja en una granja de pollos lejos del hogar.

Mayra, tiene una tortilleria desde hace 2 años se dedica a esta actividad, ella aprendió a hacer tortillas desde muy pequeña, ya que su madre le enseño para que les hiciera las tortillas a sus hermanos, porque ella se dedicaba a trabajar como doméstica para llevar dinero para los gastos del hogar.

Mayra, necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar maíz y leña, con esto pretende ampliar más el volumen de ventas y obtener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Mayra, sueña con hacer su casa de ladrillo, porque su casa es de bahareque y lámina, además sueña con tener mayores fuentes de ingresos, para darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y espera en un futuro comprar una plancha de gas, ya que el humo de la leña le hace daño en los ojos.
texts.en:
Mayra is the mother of a one year old girl.  She has a ninth grade education as she couldn’t continue studying because her family was poor.  She is in a common-law relationship, but her partner doesn’t live with her because he works on a chicken farm far from home.

Mayra has a “tortillería”, and has been engaged in this activity for two years.  She learned how to make tortillas when she was very little.  Her mother taught her how to make them for her brothers because she was working as a housekeeper to bring in money for the household expenses.

Mayra needs the money for the loan to purchase corn and firewood, and with this, she plans to increase sales volume, earn more income, and improve her quality of life.

Mayra’s house is made of adobe and laminated sheeting, but she dreams of remodeling it with brick.  In addition, she dreams of having a better source of income, and giving her daughter a better quality of life.  In the future, she hopes to buy a gas griddle because the smoke from the firewood hurts her eyes.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: God's Love Group

texts.en:
Rosemond is a 41-year-old business woman who sells wigs, cosmetics and shampoo to her many customers. She has been in the wig, cosmetic and shampoo business for the past 10 years. Her business is open 7 days a week, from 8am to 6pm. She established her business to pay school fees, buy learning materials and provide food to support her child in school. Rosemond stands on the right in the picture.

Rosemond and her group member need a loan totaling GHS 5,000. Rosemond is entitled to GHS 2,500 of it. 

She hopes that this loan will help her generate additional profit to support her family. In the future, Rosemond plans to save more money to provide for her child’s university education. She believes educating her child to university level will better the lives of her family.

Rosemond and the rest of her group thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy wigs, cosmetics and shampoo to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Libardo

texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old and is a married man who works 6 days a week, 10 hours a day. He works that hard not only because he wants to give a better life to his wife and family, but because he loves what he does, and people love what he sells. He has a little cart where he sells mangos with salt, pepper and lemon to people; this is a well-known product in Colombia that everybody loves, and that´s why he does so well. 

The cart where Jose sells his mangos is really old and damaged, and he needs it to keep doing his job; without it can get really difficult for him, that’s why he’s asking for a loan so he can pay for the remodeling and to buy a new umbrella that protects him and his mangos from the rain. 

Jose has really big dreams that he wants to accomplish soon. He wants to improve his house because it’s not in good condition, so he doesn’t feel comfortable and protected. 

With a little help from you, he can do really good and will make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for the remodeling and to buy a new umbrella

loans.name: Ephrance

texts.en:
Ephrance is a hard working woman. Ephrance is 22-years-old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 1.5 years, Ephrance has been working hard to manage her poultry business rearing chicken. 

To help expand her business, Ephrance has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy feed and vaccines. This will help Ephrance generate greater profits and expand her business. Ephrance hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Ephrance is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her poultry business.

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en: Ulata is a 72-year-old mother with seven children. She is still strong enough to run her business with the help of her children. Ulata requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of twisties, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, and a box of milk to assist her to run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of twisties , a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, and a box of milk..

loans.name: Dúo Luisa Alejandra De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Dúo Luisa Alejandra de Villa Nueva
Sara es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 18, 16, 11,9 años de edad, inicio su negocio hace 5 años cuando se separo de su esposo y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y llevar los ingresos al hogar, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de diferentes marcas avon, lecleire, esika, también se dedica a trabajar medio tiempo por las mañanas, solicita el crédito para comprar productos en oferta (cosmeticos) para tener mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The Duo Luisa Alejandra de Villa Nueva Group

Sara is a single mother of 4 children who are 18, 16, 11, and 9 years old.  She began her business 5 years ago when she separated from her husband and she saw the need to work and bring income into the home.  

She works selling different brands of cosmetics by catalogue such as  “Avon,” “LeCleire” and “Esika.” She also works part-time in the mornings.  She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetic products on sale to have merchandize to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.en:
Jorge is a 48-year-old married man who has three children who are 21, 19 and 16 years old. He lives in Marinilla, a town known for how good the people from there do in business, and he’s not an exception. He owns a farm where he grows different kind of vegetables, fruits and plants, a job that he takes very seriously and that he loves to do.

He wants to be more competitive with other farmers, so he’s going to do a big investment that helps him improve his growing a lot; that´s the reason he’s asking for a loan, so he can buy more seeds and some agricultural inputs. He wants to make his crops bigger, and offer more products to his customers.

His biggest dream is to have his own house, so he can live with his family in a nice environment where they feel protected and comfortable. You can help Jorge to accomplish all his dreams by giving him the loan that he needs.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and some agricultural inputs

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan is just 22 years old and lives in Bello, Antioquia. For a while he’s been searching how to succeed in life, and he knows that the only way is by working really hard. He started his business of selling different products like body care, clothes and other things through a recognized magazine.

To do his job, he has to first buy the products and then sell them. That’s the reason he asked for a loan, so he can get more stuff like beauty products to sell and that way increase not only the profits, but the customers who buy what he offers. He’s decided to transform his business into a successful one that helps him to pay his studies and to help his family.

His biggest dream is to become a great entrepreneur and to direct a big company in the future, an ambitious wish that he’s sure he will accomplish someday. 

So you can help Juan to come closer to fulfill what he wants by making a loan that help him improve his business.

loans.use: to get more stuff to sell and to stock up on beauty products

loans.name: Sandra Liliana

texts.en:
Sandra is a 36-year-old woman. She is a mother of two, a boy who is 10 years and a girl who is 8. She lives in a town called Libano, where she owns a farm where she grows coffee, a job that Colombia is recognized for in the entire world. Her coffee is of excellent quality.

She wants to invest in this business, so she asked for a loan to buy some agricultural inputs to keep growing coffee. She wants to increase her profits so she will be able to give better support to all her family, and she’s going to accomplish that by improving her crop.

She dreams that someday she will give her son the best education so he, one day, can become a professional and a good person. She also wants to improve the condition of her house. She’s not far away from fulfilling her goals, and with a little help, she’s going to do it sooner than she thought.

loans.use: to buy some agricultural inputs to keep growing coffee

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 30-year-old single mom who lives in Tabasco and supports her two kids. She works as a cleaning lady in a private home an hour away from her house. 
Her family lives in a house made with perishable and dangerous materials. Gladys wants nothing more for her kids than to grow up in a safe and proper home. She has been saving up as much as she can from her USD 500 per month income. Since her income is not guaranteed, access to credit is very limited and nearly impossible.
Gladys is asking for a loan so she can buy the necessary materials and hire certified technicians to supervise the work. With the loan she wants to build her kids a quality and safe home. With this opportunity, Gladys will be able to give her family what they need: new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy materials to start building her house.

loans.name: Nagiib Yusuf

texts.en:
Nagiib is a 27-year-old man. He is married and has two children, one boy and one girl, and both of them are not yet at school age. Nagiib finished his University in 2014. He studied development studies at Admas University.

When he finished his university he worked for one of the international non-governmental organizations in Somaliland, but now his contract is finished. To take on his family responsibility, Nagiib bought three different cars, a mini-bus, a taxi and a Land Cruiser for business purposes. The mini-bus is rented by schools to take students their homes and to bring them to schools, the taxi works in Hargeisa city, while the Land Cruiser is rented to a number of LNGO's when they are going their fieldworks.

Nevertheless Nagiib faces a major problem, as his main income generating Land Cruiser's gearbox stops working. So he has requested a loan of USD 1,650 from Kaaba to buy the gearbox. Kaaba will purchase the gearbox that Nagiib’s Land Cruiser needs and will provide it as a loan, and he will then make monthly repayments. In the future, Nagib wants to buy more cars to rent and to get more income.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox for his Land Cruiser.

loans.name: Iulai

texts.en: Iulai is a 41-year-old mother with six children. She runs a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Iulai requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and rain coat to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2008, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and a rain coat.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is a 59-year-old mother with eight children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. Faafetai requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 55, as a single woman living in San Pedro, Dumingag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, she runs a snack vending store that primarily supports her family. Aida never gets tired of tending her store which she does every day. 

Aida is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has already taken out several loans. She has religiously repaid her obligations without any records of default. Now, Aida has borrowed another loan to purchase flour, eggs and boxes of soft drinks to sell. Having enough inventory means income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs and boxes of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a businesswoman in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 56 years old, married, and a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

Guadalupe runs a mini-grocery store, selling canned goods, detergent, beauty soaps, and other items. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. 

Recently, she applied for a loan, amounting to PHP 49,900 to restock her mini-grocery store with canned goods, detergent, beauty soaps, and other consumable items. 

Guadalupe believes that having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to restock her mini-grocery store with canned goods, detergent, beauty soaps, shampoo, and other consumable items.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is 39 years old, married, and has a sari-sari store business in Plaridel. This is how she supports her family, with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. 

Recently, Lea availed herself of a loan to purchase inventories for her sari-sari store, like condiments, consumable goods, and confectioneries. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase inventories for her sari-sari store, like condiments, consumable goods, and confectioneries.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 44 years old and single, from Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her business involves cosmetics and beauty products sold to her friends and neighborhood. She does this work to support her parents. 

Shirley asked for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase cosmetics and beauty products, like lotion, facial powder, cream, and fragrance for her buy-and-sell business. Having more products available for sale will increase her income and would help her support the needs of her parents.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and beauty products, like lotion, facial powder, cream, and fragrance for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Primitive

texts.en:
Primitive aged 36 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 10 years. 1 of them goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 33 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 7 years, two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested his maize.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 38-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Delia has a repair shop in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

Delia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee aged 41 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 13 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a cow for rearing. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Lucely Yaneth

texts.es:
Sacar sus tres hijas adelante a sus tres hijas menores de edad, es la meta que se propuso la señora Lucely quien con su negocio de confección a terceros quiere lograr la gloria, ahora pide ayuda a la comunidad Kiva para que le den un impulso para comenzar con su negocio ya que por al falta de capital no ha podido comprar los insumos.

Lucely quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, bonotes. 

Si todo sale bien esta mujer tendrá un negocio sostenible en el tiempo y una vez saque a sus hijas adelante pensara en comprar vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Moving her three young daughters forward is the goal that Lucely has set forth for herself. She wants to achieve this goal with her tailoring business. She is now asking for help from the Kiva community to give her a boost so that she can start her business, since she has not been able to buy supplies due to a lack of capital.

Lucely is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, threads, and buttons. If everything goes well, this woman will in time have a sustainable business. Once she moves her daughters forward, she will think about buying her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, and buttons.

loans.name: Loteuaina

texts.en: Loteuaina is a Samoan citizen. She is 35 years old with four children. She runs a business selling chips in her village and at the market to earn a living. Loteuaina hopes to gain more profit to expand her business, but in order to do this, she requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan, and a wooden spoon. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan, and wooden spoon.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children and describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved livelihoods. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs for her farm which supports both cows and crops

loans.name: Willy Oscar

texts.es:
Willy Oscar tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene una menor hija, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la Sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Willy se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 01 año, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Willy espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Willy Oscar is 25 years old. His civil status is single. He has a minor daughter. He lives in the district of Cayalti, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in the community is tranquil. The people work principally in commerce and raising small animals.

Willy's offers passenger transportation service in his vehicle (a motorcycle taxi), an activity that he has been doing for more than a year. He has experience in this area and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be used to make repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle, since it is now in bad condition. Willy hopes to offer better service to his customers, which will generate greater income for him and in the end improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en:
Aifai is 43 years old with four children. 

Aifai operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Aifai requested a loan to buy a banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2011 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Rubinsita

texts.en:
Rubinsita works hard to support her family. Rubinsita is married and has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Rubinsita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Rubinsita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rubinsita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille aged 31 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 8 years. 1 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de El Retiro con su esposa y sus hijos que tiene en la universidad.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de comidas como chuzos de cerdo y hamburguesas. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas con 1 empleado
Su negocio consiste en la preparación y venta de estos alimentos en un pequeño restaurante. El ofrece sus productos de la mejor manera posible e intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 
Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad.

El solicita un préstamo para la adecuación y ampliación de su zona de cocinado y de atención a clientes, de esta forma podrá mejorar su atención, servicio y calidad.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a veteran of the thousand battles he has survived throughout his live. He lives in the El Retiro district with his wife and with his children, who are university students. He is a very hardworking man who has been working for some time in the business of selling food such as hot dogs and hamburgers.

He works every day for 7 hours with one employee. His business consists of food preparation and sales in a small restaurant. He prepares his products in the best way possible and tries to satisfy his need for complete perfection.  Francisco states that it is a simple business to carry out at his age.

He is requesting a loan to modify and expand his cooking space and his service to customers, which will enable him to improve his service and quality. The loan will give him the opportunity to capitalize on his business and will boost his work, allowing him to obtain resources to fund his children's university studies.

loans.use: to modify and expand his cooking space and his service to customers, which will enable him to improve his service and quality.

loans.name: Saoleagasitasia

texts.en: Saoleagasitasia is a 39-year-old mother with eight children. She runs a small business providing a good service to people by transportation. Saoleagasitasia requested a loan to buy new wheels, paint, car seats and an air conditioner to help her maintain the good service. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint, car seats and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie, aged 55 and separated, is a businesswoman in Sindangan. She runs a store selling condiments, confectionery and boxes of soft drinks. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially her children's education.

Ma. Tessie is a microfinance member of PMPC. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with condiments, confectionery and boxes of soft drinks to sell. She believes that having enough inventory will allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to restock her store with condiments, confectionery and boxes of soft drinks

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda, aged 65, is a widow from Tipan, Oroquieta City. She has been involved in her denture-making business for 15 years. This type of business has supported her family and has enabled her to send her children to school up to college level. 

Rosenda signed up for membership after learning that Paglaum MPC (PMPC) provides financial assistance to small-scale service providers like her. Currently, she is taking out a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase raw materials for her denture-making business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her denture-making business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and lives in Sindangan. She has been engaged in managing a fishing business, together with her husband as the fisherman, for the past 15 years, and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has now requested a loan to be used to purchase materials such as plywood, bronze nails, and epoxy for the construction of a new fishing boat. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand their fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as plywood, bronze nails, and epoxy for the construction of a new boat

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. 

Erlinda borrowed an amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. 

Erlinda looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
Luz Estella una ama de casa creativa, habilidosa que se encontraba en su hogar desperdiciando su talento como confeccionista, encontró una ayuda para comprar una maquina con la que está generando progreso, ahora para seguir con su sueño de tener su propio negocio viene solicitando una ayuda para la compra de una maquina fileteadora y tela para empezar su labor.

Su sueño es tener independencia económica y revivir aquella ilusión de comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Luz Estella is a creative and skillful housewife who found herself at home wasting her talent as a tailor. She acquired some help to buy a sewing machine with which she has made progress.

Now, in order to continue with her dream of having her own business, she is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric so that she can start her work. Her dream is to have financial independence and to revive her dream of buying her own house.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric so that she can start her work.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 55 years old and married with six children. Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Lucila has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, coffee, etc. 

Lucila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucy Amparo

texts.es:
Lucy desde hace aproximadamente 16 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como de productos de uso personal, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa.

Lucy, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Lucy has been working as an independent saleswoman for the last 16 years, a job that she learned through experience out of the necessity to provide resources to support her family. She sells many types of products, such as clothing, perfume, body cream, accessories, and others. She has the advantage that she meets new people daily to whom she can offer her sales, expanding her business every day.

She currently is requesting support from a loan to buy wholesale merchandise such as personal products, so that she can stock a greater variety to satisfy the increased demand.

With tenacity and dedication, Lucy wishes to keep working and move her business forward in the near future. She dreams of the possibility of opening her own store in a mall, where she can offer greater variety of products, which will give her favorable profitability and economic stability.'

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as personal products, so that she can stock a greater variety to satisfy the increased demand.

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.en:
Olga is a 29-year-old married woman who has a beautiful baby daughter who is only four years old. She lives in a town called Fresno, and is an entrepreneur. She works hard so she can give her family a good life. She owns two businesses; one is selling yogurt which she makes and the other is selling some lovely craft foamy decorations that she makes herself.

Dealing with two businesses is not an easy job, and can turn really expensive. That’s why Olga needs a loan so she can buy inputs to make all her yogurt and craft decorations. This way she can offer diverse options to her clients so she improves her sales and increases her profits. She wishes for a successful business that will be recognized by all the community.

Olga dreams big, and wants to give her family a good life. She is sure that she's going to make her family really happy by working really hard and getting them to an excellent position. You can help Olga to make her art and delicious yogurt by loaning her the money she needs to do so.

loans.use: to buy inputs to make all her yogurt and craft decorations.

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en: Foisaga is a 39-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches, toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Foisaga requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter and mayonnaise.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: Valeria tiene 67 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su quiosco hace varios años. Hace años atrás prestar servicios de ama de  casa. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas de toda variedad y bebidas. El grupo LA AMISTAD agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Valeria es la primera del lado derecho
texts.en: Valeria is 67 years old, married, with one dependent child. She has worked selling candies in her kiosk for several years. Years ago, she served as a housewife. The loan will be invested in buying more candies and beverages of all types. LA AMISTAD group thanks KIVA lenders for the support provided. Valeria is the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy more candy and beverages.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and has a 7-year-old daughter. He lives in Fresno, a beautiful Colombian town where he owns a farm. In it he grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables and with this business he has provided for his family for many years and loves to do it, because he believes that family always come first.

Luis is beginning to grow lulo, a delicious fruit well known in Colombia and in a lot of South American countries. He started two months ago, so it needs a lot of good care so it can grow well. That’s why he’s asking for a loan, so he can buy the products he requires to manage the growth and some agricultural products. He wants to sell good quality fruit because he likes his customers to feel well served and satisfied.

He wants to be able to pay for his daughter's education and some day improve his house conditions that are not in a really good situation. He dreams big and loves what he does. These things and the love for his family make him work hard, so with a little help he can succeed in all that he wants to accomplish.

loans.use: to buy the products he requires to manage the growth of his new lulo and some agricultural products.

loans.name: Eusebio Enrique

texts.es:
Eusebio es un padre soltero cabeza de familia de 40 años de edad, una persona verraca, pujante, luchadora, nacida y educada en el campo que se dedica a la cría de pollos, negocio con el cual genera el sustento de su familia conformada por sus tres hijos y claro esta su hogar el cual se sueña remodelado, organizado, solo para dejarlo de herencia a sus 3 muchachos.

Eusebio es un criador de animales que están siempre buscando como mejorar su negocio, busca alianzas, convenios que generen rentabilidad a su negocio y que lo obliguen a realizar cambios y aumentar su producción.

Ya que encontró la manera de cómo mejorar sus ingresos, con un socio que desea comprarle, busca un apoyo financiero para la compra de pollos de levante, adecuación de galpones, alimentos para pollos, lo que trata de lograr es tener un mayor número de animales y galpones en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a 40-year-old single father and the head of the family. He is a brave, vigorous, and determined person who was born and educated in the countryside. There he works in the breeding of chickens, a business that generates the family's livelihood. 

His family consists of his three sons. They live in a house where Eusenio dreams to remodel and re-organize, solely to leave it for his sons as inheritance. 

Eusebio is a breeder of animals who is always looking to improve his business. He looks for partnerships and agreements that bring profitability to his business, and that requires him to create changes and increase his production. Since he already found a way to improve his income, along with a partner that wishes to buy from him, he is looking for financial support to purchase chickens, to renovate the sheds, and to buy chicken feed. 

His goal is to have a bigger number of animals and sheds with optimal conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for rearing, to renovate the sheds, and to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the capital needed to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. He is thankful that the capital was extended to him as a small-time borrower. 

These days, Elpedio has been able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales. He wants to take advantage of this good fortune. Recently, Elpedio took out a loan of PHP 7,000 to restock boxes of drinks to sell. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for his family.

loans.use: to restock boxes of drinks to sell

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Victor se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 
Ya que ha laborado 15 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas con un empleado.

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de herramientas para facilitar su trabajo como tranzador, prensa, compresor, un soldador y herramienta de mano. 

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que la herramienta que utiliza esta en mal estado y hay otra que le hace falta.

Actualmente es casado y vive con su esposa.
texts.en:
Victor works successfully in his metal shop and metal soldering business. He is a very well known person in the neighborhood because of his good work and service.

Since he has worked for 15 years with the knowledge that he acquired through his work in different shops, he has had the opportunity to keep up his work and has tried to improve the living conditions of his family.

He works every day for seven hours with one employee.

For this reason he wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of tools to facilitate his work, such as a saw, a press, a compressor, a welder, and a hand tool.

With these items he will be able to continue offering his services, since the tools that he uses are in bad condition, and there is another one that he needs.

He is now married and lives with his wife

loans.use: to buy tools to facilitate his work, such as a saw, a press, a compressor, a welder, and hand tools

loans.name: Heribella

texts.en:
Heribella is 41 years old and married from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

Heribella is a fish vendor supported by her fisherman husband. She signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and availed a loan product amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase more fish available for resale. 

Heribella religiously repays her contribution so that she can maintain her good records with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Karen Sofia

texts.es:
Karen ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de ropa para dama y caballero, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad de productos, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Karen manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Karen has been a very dedicated housewife, always attentive to the care of her family, which is formed by her two children and her husband. She has always liked to work as an independent businesswoman. She began to sell merchandise 5 years ago, since she is responsible for bearing the economic responsibility of the household, along with her husband, and she needs to generate the resources to do it.

Her customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends from the sector. She works alone in her business every day, and in her work she finds the advantage of being able to be attentive to her family at the same time that she manages to be productive as a businesswoman.

She is now applying for the loan to buy a wholesale stock of clothing for women and men, since there is a great opportunity at this season of the year. This will allow her to stock up with a greater variety of products, giving as a result the acquisition of better income for her family.

Karen states that her great desire is to be able to continue supporting her family economically and give an education to all her children, in order to see them become professionals and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy a wholesale stock of clothing for women and men, since there is a great opportunity at this season of the year. This will allow her to stock up with a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Blanca Araceli

texts.en:
Blanca is a 65-year-old woman who lives in Medellín. She comes from a really humble family and has been through many hard times, but she has accomplished finding her way in life by working really hard, 7 days a week, and by creating her own business. She works selling different kinds of products like chips, cigarettes, some drinks and gum, and has a place that she carries around some city places so she reaches a lot of customers.

The job that Blanca does isn’t easy and requires a lot of sacrifices and physical strain, but she always keeps going with her business because she wants to do better, to increase the profits so she can live better. The loan she’s requiring is for buying some inputs like coffee, cigarettes, snacks and some drinks, so she can stock up and have more to offer.

She dreams of making her house a better place because right now it is not that comfortable or good, so when she goes to rest after a long day she will have a beautiful place to arrive at. You can help Blanca with a loan so she can fulfill all her dreams.

loans.use: to buy some inputs like coffee, cigarettes, snacks and some drinks, so she can stock up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, brick, metal sheets, and sand to repair the washstand and improve the floor and roof in that area.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 55 years old, married, and lives at Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Diego Leon

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 10 años se viene dedicando a la venta de pipetas de gas.

Desde muy joven sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de pipetas de gas para fogones de comidas rápidas.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Diego is a very enterprising man who really wants to get ahead and progress.

He has been selling gas pipettes for 10 years. Since he was very young, he has felt an affinity for business and sales, so now he has great ability in this area thanks to his kindness and excellent quality of service.

He is asking for a loan to buy inventory of gas pipettes for fast food stoves.

He hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the support of people with a good heart who support this type of project, and thanks to the accompaniment of the Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy inventory of gas pipettes for fast food stoves.

loans.name: Gilberto Sr.

texts.en:
Gilberto is 51 years old and lives in Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has children. Gilberto owns and operates a business providing transport for a living to local community members. He has been doing this for eight years. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle.  In the future, Gilberto hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pigpens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Puntod, Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results for healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Alejandra knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Geses

texts.en:
Geses has a rice farm in Polo, Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. This is her primary source of income for her family. Geses makes it a point to have good land preparation to have a maximum yield that will have good income. 

Recently, she needed an amount to accumulate a rice field beside her property to increase her rice production, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Geses wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice grains in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to accumulate a rice field.

loans.name: Medardo Manuel

texts.es:
Medardo, un hombre de 51 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una chaza que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Trabaja solo todos los días durante 10 horas.

Buscando tener la mejor empresa del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como frituras, snacks y golosinas.

De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como el negocio más productivo en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Medardo con su negocio!
texts.en:
Medardo is a 51-year-old man who has given all his life for the benefit of his family, trying to raise them and together overcome all the adversities that have been presented to them in life. Thanks to a food stall that he has managed to set up with much effort, patience, and sacrifice, he has generated the income for the support of his children.

He works every day for 10 hours.

Seeking to have the best business in the sector, he wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of stock that will allow him to expand his inventory, such as fried foods, snacks, and candies.

In this way, he will overcome difficulties such as low sales and competition.

This loan will be the great opportunity to become established as the most productive business in the neighborhood and will give him the opportunity to accomplish his much longed for dream of buying his own house.

Help Medardo with his business!

loans.use: to buy stock that will allow him to expand his inventory, such as fried foods, snacks, and candies.

loans.name: Lordalita

texts.en: Lordalita is 44 years old and married with five children. She has been a wholesaler/retailer of meat in their town for almost 10 years. From this longtime experience of selling, she already has a lot of knowledge in dealing in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Lordalita still gets more customers than the rest, due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. For now, Lordalita is planning to buy a parcel of land in order to manage a new business, which is creating a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. Currently, she requested a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase pigs to butcher for her meat shop.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to butcher for her meat shop

loans.name: Luz Madeleyne

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 3 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en el que prepara y vende alimentos como arepas de maíz.

Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de insumos e ingredientes, un molino y un carro de comidas.

Una de sus principales dificultades es el alto costo de los insumos pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman with experience, wisdom and a lot of patience. She is the mother of 3 children and has worked practically her whole life to provide for them. She has a small business where she makes and sells food such as corn arepas. She works everyday for five hours to have her product fresh and ready for her customers who are mainly neighbors from the area where she lives. 

She wants to grow her business and have a stock of supplies and product inventory. This is why she is turning to a loan to buy an assortment of supplies and ingredients, a mill and a food cart. 

One of her main difficulties is the high cost of supplies but she trusts in the help from Corporación Interactuar and the good heart of Kiva lenders to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies and product inventory.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia has mastered her farming business in Tipan, Oroquieta City. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to request credit to fully support her business. In the same way that she takes care her farming business, she also takes care of her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always turn to them for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 25,000 will help her pay workers for land preparation and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay workers for land preparation and purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Molave-Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jumpstart her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Marivic feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to build her business. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Marivic wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, and harvesting, as well as earning income. Myrna has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Myrna has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Myrna hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for, and harvesting, and earning income as well. Julie has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Julie has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Julie hopes to purchase another plot of rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Silafono

texts.en: Silafono is a Samoan citizen. She is 39 years old and has two children. She runs a business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Silafono requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Levei

texts.en: Levei is a 37-year-old mother with six children. She runs a business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Levei requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei design, and containers to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD this year 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei design, and containers

loans.name: Russell

texts.en: Russell signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Russell is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 52 and married in Plaridel, he runs a store that primarily supports their family. He never tires of tending his store. 

Edgardo is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He religiously repaid his obligations without records of default. 

Now, he has taken another loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, lard, oil, butter and cheese. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities.

In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, lard, oil, butter and cheese

loans.name: Lemere

texts.en: Lemere is a 26-year-old mother with two children. She is a Samoan citizen who runs a business selling elei prints at the market to earn a living. Lemere requested a loan to buy a paint color, paint brush, rolling materials, and elei design to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a paint color, paint brush, rolling materials, and elei design

loans.name: Lorraine

texts.en: Lorraine is 18 years old and does not have any children. She runs a business selling elei prints in public to earn a living. She became a member of SPBD in 2015. Lorraine requested a loan to buy rolling material, paint color, a paint brush, and elei design to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy rolling material, paint color, paint brush, and elei design

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como almuerzos y desayunos típicos.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y 3 hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Luz solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de 1 refrigerador y surtido de ingredientes para sus preparaciones.

Con tu ayuda Luz Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising and tenacious woman with great dreams that she has been trying to cultivate and meet. She has a small business making and selling food such as lunches and traditional breakfasts. With this business she is attempting to get ahead every day and improve her family's living conditions. Her family is made up of her husband and three children who drive her life and motivation to strive daily. 

Her biggest challenge is the competition in her area but with her great capacity for work she is able to support herself and grow. Luz is requesting a loan to buy one refrigerator and an assortment of ingredients for the meals she prepares. With your help Luz can pay for her children's education which is one of her greatest dreams.

loans.use: to buy one refrigerator and an assortment of ingredients for the meals she prepares.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 19 years  old. He runs a business selling taro and banana at the market to earn a living. He has had this experience for more than a year. Michael requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), shovel, rake, and hand gloves to help him run the business. He became a member of SPBD in 2014 and will use his profit to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), shovel, rake, and hand gloves

loans.name: Natalia A Ndrea

texts.es:
Natalia, en su afán por buscar la manera de obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento y educación de sus hijos, opto por montar un negocio de preparación y venta de comestibles como palitos de queso y pasteles.

Con este negocio intenta salir adelante día a día, es por eso que solicita un apoyo económico en la Corporación Interactuar para comprar harina, azúcar, una caldera, cajas plásticas para empacar alimentos, utensilios de cocina, un fogón de gas, una vitrina y un calentador; elementos que le permitirán tener un mejor negocio con más llamativo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Natalia, in her quest to find the necessary resources for the support and education of her children, chose to start a business making and selling food such as cheese sticks and cakes. 

With this business she is hoping to get ahead day-by-day this is why she is requesting economic support from Corporación Interactuar to buy, flour, sugar, a boiler, plastic boxes to package food, kitchen utensils, a gas stove, a display cabinet and a heater. These items will allow her to have a better, more appealing business for her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a boiler, plastic boxes to package food, kitchen utensils, a stove, a display cabinet and a heater.

loans.name: Relwende Group

texts.fr:
M. OUMAROU est responsable du groupe  RELWENDE 1 DE TANGHIN. Marié il est père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 01 ans. 05 enfants vont à l’école et il a 11 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis 35 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 03 moutons, une (01) chèvre et 01 sac d’engrais. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il a pour ambition d’être plus tard un grands agriculteur-éleveur.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumara is the representative of the Relwende 1 group of Tanghin. He is married with ten children. His eldest is 22 years old and his youngest is one year old. Five of his children currently attend school. He has 11 dependents. Oumara has been growing farm crops and raising animals for 35 years. He  buys his supplies at local markets. 

He plans to use his loan to buy three sheep, one goat and one bag of fertilizer. Oumara would like to use his revenues to pay for his children's schooling. His dream is to become a major livestock farmer one day.

loans.use: to buy three sheep, one goat and one bag of fertilizer.

loans.name: Faamaluoaiga

texts.en: Faamaluoaiga is 25 years old with four children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Faamaluoaiga requested a loan to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes and seedlings, taro roots and seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Sugalu

texts.en: Sugalu is a 30-year-old mother with two children. She runs a business of sewing clothes and sells them in her community to earn a living. Sugalu requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, a tape measure, and containers, to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, a tape measure, and containers.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Mantener dos hogares uno propio donde vive y tiene un negocio de cría de peces y otro donde habitan sus 4 hijos es una tarea ardua y de mucho responsabilidad pero Pedro la asume con responsabilidad ya que sabe lo importante que son los recursos que brinda para sus hijos pues con estos se alimentan dignamente.

Para ser claros Pedro se separó de su esposa, pero Pedro sigue en pie de lucha, trabajando por su progreso, por sacar a sus hijos adelante y necesita mayores recursos para enviarlos a la universidad.

Pedro solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimento para peces, alevinos y cachetama.
texts.en:
To support two households, one where he lives and has a business raising fish and the other where his four children live is a difficult task and much responsibility. But Pedro has taken on the responsibility as he knows how important the resources are that he provides for his children as with them they can eat properly.

To be clear Pedro is separated from his wife but he continues to strive, working for his progress, to raise his kids and he needs greater resources to send them to university. Pedro is requesting a loan to buy feed for fish, fry and cachama.

loans.use: to buy feed for fish, fry and cachama.

loans.name: Tusitina

texts.en: Tusitina is a 30-year-old mother with two children. She runs a business of providing good services to people through transportation. Tusitina requested a loan to buy new wheels, paints, car seats, and air conditioning, to help her maintain her good service. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paints, car seats, and air conditioning for her taxi business.

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en: Tepora is a 30-year-old mother with one child. She runs a business of providing a service to people through cutting grass to earn a living. Tepora requested a loan to buy a lawn-mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, safety boots, and a safety uniform, to assist her in running the business. She will expand her business using her profit, and she became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a lawn-mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, safety boots, and a safety uniform for her business mowing people's yards.

loans.name: Leala

texts.en:
Leala is 27 years old and single with three children. For the past three years she has made and sold tasty pancakes in her community.

Leala joined Kiva's field partner SPBD in 2014 to avail herself of its business loans. She has applied for a 1,500 WST loan to buy corn flour, chicken, a cooking pot and shopping bags for her business. With her earnings Leala plans to start another business baking paifala, or half-moon pies to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, chicken, a cooking pot and shopping bags for her business.

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en: Sieni is 42 years old with five children. She runs a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Sieni requested a loan to buy banana tubes and seedlings, taro roots and seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and a chainsaw, to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes and seedlings, taro roots and seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and chainsaw.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: Ernestina tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de sándwich hace poco de manera ambulatoria en centros educativos. Y a la vez expende pan en horas de la mañana. Ella tiene como fin implementar su negocio con la venta de gaseosas y agua. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de agua y gaseosas. El grupo LAS GARDENIAS agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.  Ernestina se encuentra en medio viste jean de color azul.
texts.en:
Ernestina, 39, lives with a partner and has two dependent children. She makes a living selling sandwiches, recently as a street vendor in educational centers. She also sells bread in the morning. 

She intends to start selling carbonated beverages and water through her business, and this loan will be used to buy these items. The Las Gardenias group is grateful to KIVA investors for providing this loan. 

Ernestina is in the middle of the photo wearing blue jeans.

loans.use: to buy water and carbonated beverages

loans.name: Mau

texts.en: Mau is 30 years old with four children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Mau requested \a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes and seedlings, taro roots and seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes and seedlings, taro roots and seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is a 43-year-old woman who is married with three children. For the past four years she has run a business sewing and selling dresses and kids’ clothes in her community.

Faaiuga joined Kiva's field partner SPBD in 2010 to avail herself of its business loans. She has applied for a 2,500 WST loan to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread, fabric and scissors. She plans to use her profits to support her family and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread, fabric and scissors.

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio De Peronia Group

texts.es: Dúo San Antonio de Peronia Francisca es vendedora de comida y se dedica a la venta de tamales y chuchitos además prepara comida para eventos. Cada día lucha para seguir adelante y se esmera para lograr tener un negocio más grande y tener todo lo necesario para salir adelante,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
Francisca works in the sale of food such as tamales and chuchitos [small tamales wrapped in maize husks], and also caters for events. Every day she strives to get ahead, doing her best to grow her business and to have everything she needs to suceed.

At this moment, she is requesting a loan so she may buy the supplies she needs to make the meals she sells.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to make the meals she sells.

loans.name: German De Jesus

texts.es:
German, es un hombre de 36 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2010, monto su negocio ofreciendo ropa para dama y niña, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 
Trabaja solo durante 10 horas todos los días.

German se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor como accesorios y ropa para surtir su negocio con el fin de atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar, así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
German is a 36 year old man who has worked for some years at various labor activities but always with a desire in his mind to move into the commercial area. It was in the year 2010 he started his business by offering clothing for women and girls, with which he had great success over the years of its operation. He works alone for 10 hours everyday.  

German characterizes himself as an enterprising, kind man, with vision and a high desire to succeed.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale merchandise such as accessories and clothing to stock up his business. Thereby, he can attract more customers and offer a variety of products that satisfy the needs and desires of those who visit his business.

In this way he will be able to earn income to continue contributing to the economy of his home, have a more prosperous future, and markedly improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise such as accessories and clothing to stock up his business in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
Liliana, con 38 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja con un empleado todos los días durante 8 horas, la actividad la aprendió a través de una amiga y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para adecuar un local y poder poner allí su peluquería, lo que le permitira prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Liliana con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Liliana is 38 years old, is the mother of two children and along with her husband is responsible for her household.

For the past four years she has worked in her own business, a beauty salon. She started it as an alternative to generate resources that would allow her to care for the well-being of her family. She works with an employee every day for 8 hours. She learned the business through a friend and little by little she has gained more knowledge and perfected her technique. This has allowed her to become known in the area for the quality of her service.
