She is currently requesting the support of a loan to rent a space to put her hairdressing shop which will allow her to provide better service as her clients will be more comfortable. This will help her improve her sales and the income she makes.

With her perseverance and vision into the future Liliana wants to expand her beauty salon where she can generate more employment opportunities for woman who are the head of their family. This would result in more well-being not only for her family but also help other people who could enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a space to put her hairdressing shop which will allow her to provide better service.

loans.name: Molita

texts.en:
Molita, 35, is single and has four children. For the past three years she has printed material and sewn up clothing using her elei, a Samoan fabric that is block-printed by hand using paint and a wooden elei board inscribed with designs.

Molita joined Kiva's field partner SPBD in 2011 to avail herself of its financial services. She has applied for a 2,000 WST loan to buy fabric paints, an elei board, material, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education and to support her family as well.

loans.use: to buy materials to make elei and use it to make clothing

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa, con 20 años de edad, es soltera. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, un visionaria y buena negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo productos de uso personal en el municipio de Medellín y, desde hace 1 año tiene este negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Vanessa acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido al por mayor e inventario de desodorantes, lociones, cremas, entre otros. 

Vanessa es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la inseguridad en su barrio a mano de las bandas criminales.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 20 years old and single. She is recognized as being very responsible and hardworking, a visionary and a good businesswoman.

She has always worked as a merchant, selling personal products in the city of Medellin. She has her own business since 1 year ago.

She has overcome hard times in business and dreams of improving her housing conditions and to have a business that lasts over time. Therefore, Vanessa requests a loan to buy wholesale assortment and inventory of deodorants, lotions, creams, etc.

Vanessa is very organized even though she had to deal with insecurity in her neighborhood due to criminal gangs.

All of her efforts will add up to provide her family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale assortment and inventory of deodorants, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene gran experiencia en el área de ventas y comida, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia chaza en la que vende tinto y pasteles.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días durante 4 horas.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio económico para realizar la compra de ingredientes como café, pollos, entre otros; además desea comprar otro carro para ofrecer un empleo y mejorar sus ventas.
El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y con un mejor capital.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un local en el cual pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria has an extensive experience in sales and food. It has been some time since she began her own stand selling coffee and pastries.

She has always preferred to work independently. She works every day for four hours.

Currently she needs financial aid to buy ingredients such as coffee, chickens, etc. She also wants to buy another cart to create an employment and improve her sales.

The loan will allow her to work in better conditions and with more capital.

Her biggest dream is to have an establishment where she can offer her products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as coffee, chickens, etc. She also wants to buy another cart to create an employment and improve her sales.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a 55-year-old mother with 8 children. She owns and operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living.

Evelina has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. 

She will use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios para celulares, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a su madre, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como mujer pujante y emprendedora busca el sustento para su hogar.

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Claudia se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes. 
Trabaja con un empleado todos los días durante 6 horas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios, calzado, bisutería para añadirlos a su portafolio de productos.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
Claudia started selling various goods, specifically cellular accessories, several months ago, an occupation she learned thanks to her mother. She sought this occupation as an alternative to generate money, and as a strong and enterprising woman she seeks to cover the expenses of her household.

Due to such a high cost of living, Claudia finds herself needing to generate a higher income. It’s for this reason that she needs economic support that would help her improve the variety of products that she carries and offers daily to her customers.  She works with an employee every day for 6 hours. 

She's requesting a loan to buy accessories, shoes, and costume jewelry to add to her portfolio of products.

Her main dream is to become the owner of her own shop.

loans.use: buy accessories, shoes, and costume jewelry to add to her portfolio of products.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, trabaja todos los días prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su moto a través del municipio de Cañasgordas posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy organizado, es soltero y sostiene a su hija a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su moto ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Juan con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working young man; he works daily providing transportation to people on his motorbike throughout the municipality of Cañasgordas, making it possible for people in the community to get to even the most remote areas of the municipality.

He is a kind, helpful man, and very organized.  Juan is single and supports his daughter, for whom he has always provided the best possible way of life.

Juan is asking for a loan to carry out maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle since that is his only way to work.

With this  loan, he will be able to improve his vehicle and continue providing services with complete safety security and without placing his daughter or his customers at risk.  Help Juan with a loan today.

loans.use: to carry out  maintenance and repairs on  his motorbike since this is his only means of transport

loans.name: Lutbat

texts.en:
Mr. Lutbat, 55, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi services to local people since 2011.

Using his previous loan, he replaced the old windows of his apartment with new double glazed ones. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy some building materials such as fiberglass, foam, and plastics to renovate his apartment. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less energy is wasted on heating.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.

Nerissa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Nerissa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela is a 44-year-old mother with 7 children. She runs a business providing transportation services to people to earn a living.

Ela hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, she requested a loan to pay for seat covers, painting, new windows, new wheels, and license renewal, which will help her maintain good service. She hopes to use her profits to buy another taxi. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to pay for seat covers, painting, new windows, new wheels, and license renewal

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de almuerzo.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chuquiaguillo’ que es un paso obligado de aquellos que se dirigen en dirección a las poblaciones de los Yungas de La Paz. Hasta mediados del siglo XX, este lugar era de uso privado que se dedicaban a la agricultura y el pastoreo.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de almuerzo como; pollo a la broaster, asado de res, medio lomo, milanesa de res y de pollo y otros. Su negocio lo administra ella con ayuda de un familiar que trabaja como mesera, “inicié mi negocio vendiendo comida en la puerta de mi casa, luego logré el capital necesario para alquilar un cuarto donde trabajo ahora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos y ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para ampliar los servicios y mejorar el menú. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina espiadera para vender pollos al espiedo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de un máquina espiadera para vender pollo al espiedo y ofrecer una nueva comida en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Maria is a 37 year old woman, single, who has a 12-year old daughter, and whose business is selling lunches.  She is a good mother, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and very hard-working.  She works at her business in the  'Chuquiaguillo’ area, where those who are heading toward the towns of  the Yungas de La Paz must pass.   Until mid-20th century, this area was in private hands, used for agriculture and pasturage.

Maria is brown-skinned, with brown eyes and long dark hair which she wears caught up behind her neck.  She is short, of medium complexion; her native language is  Aymará,which she speaks at home.  She speaks Spanish as a matter of general knowledge and in the work she does.  Maria shares her life with her daughter, a school girl.  They live in a rented house made of bricks and cement, with a roof of corruged metal and wood floor, which has electricity, drinkable water and a sewer system.  

Maria's work is selling lunches such as:  broaster chicken, roast beef, beef loin, beef or chicken Milanese and others. She carries out her business with the help of an friend who works as waitress.  "I began my business selling food at the door of my houses; then I earned the necessary money to rent the place where I now work," she comments.  The advantage Maria's business has is that she counts on faithful customers and daily sales; the disadvantage is lack of capital to increase services and improve the menu.  Maria's dream is to improve her business; she wants to buy a rotisserie to be able to cook and sell chicken on skewers.  This is the first sequence of loans with the organization in the ten years she has been carrying out this activity.  

These are the reasons why Maria is asking for a loan: to buy a rotisserie to cook chicken on skewers and offer a new type of food in her food stall.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie cooker in order to sell chicken on skewers and offer a new food choice in her sales area

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 59, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines. Avelina has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of frozen food to sell.

Avelina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenesuvd, 33 years old, lives with her husband and child in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a machinist at a mining company for 10 months. Her husband makes and sells blocks to building companies. Their child goes to elementary school. 

The house her family lives in has been deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. So she is requesting a loan of $1,550 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for her house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Altsansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Altansukh, 49 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling recycled materials to the local people since 2008. His wife runs a grocery store, and his son renders taxi service. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Adora dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is seeking a loan of  $1,500 to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy things every day. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, noodles, and candles.

She has been involved in these business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Isabel independent because she can be responsible for herself and it also allows her to help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her general store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sugar, salt, coffee, milk, water, beer, cigarettes and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, coffee, milk, water, beer, cigarettes and biscuits.

loans.name: Cristian Eduardo

texts.es:
Cristian, de 26 años, inicio con un negocio de estampación y publicidad hace aproximadamente 4 meses con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su hija y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hija tiene 4 meses y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como pintura, moldes, papel, tintes, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá mejorar su capital, sostener su negocio y a su hija brindándole una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Cristian para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Cristian is 26 years old and started his own printing business four months ago in order to earn an income to survive.

Cristian's motivation to work constantly is his daughter, and his desire to offer her the best possible for her life and development. Cristian's daughter is four months old and has become the source of happiness for this hard-working man.

Cristian is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies, such as paint, moulds, paper, dye and more.

This loan will allow Cristian to increase his assets, keep his business going, and provide his daughter with a higher quality of life.

Support Cristian so that he might continue with his business!

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as paint, moulds, paper, dye and more.

loans.name: Agerica

texts.en:
Agerica is 44 years old and has eight children. She is married and five of her children are in school.

Agerica is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Agerica requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Agerica has been in this business for 24 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Agerica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lorlita

texts.en:
Lorlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorlita is 56 years old and two of her children are in school.

Lorlita has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Lorlita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Barbara is 58 years old now.

Barbara has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Barbara has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Barbara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Dolores has a buy and sell of beverages business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy coconut wine and other beverages to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine and other beverages to sell.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is 30 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and now she is applying for her second loan of $600. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cigarettes, water, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, beer, bread, biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and candles. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) for offering loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, water, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, beer, bread, biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and candles.

loans.name: Sue

texts.en: Sue is 57 years old with four children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Sue requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 48 years old and married with three children. Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business.

Helen has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alfreda is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Alfreda has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Alfreda requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

Alfreda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell (CDs, DVDs)

loans.name: Elena Emily

texts.en:
Elena Emily is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like school supplies, home care products, and groceries.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Elena Emily would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like school supplies, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a  20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
En el cuidado y lavados de vehículos encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Luis que a sus 53 años es un hombre muy trabajador.

Vive en el municipio de Frontino desde donde se desempeña en este negocio para sostener a su familia.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de un equipo de lavado, insumos de limpieza, estampas, entre otros.
Estos elementos le permitirán continuar con su labor.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de infraestructura para poder trabajar.

Apoya a Luis con su negocio y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Through maintaining and washing vehicles, many people find an opportunity to progress and get ahead in a modest and brave way. This is the case for Luis who, at the age of 53, is a very hard-working man. 

He lives in the Municipality of Frontino, from where he started this business to support his family. 

Luis is asking for financial support in order to buy washing equipment, cleaning supplies, prints and other items. These items will allow him to continue with his work.

One of the big difficulties that he has had to deal with is the lack of infrastructure to be able to work. Support Luis with his business and make his life better with a loan.

loans.use: to buy washing equipment, cleaning supplies, prints and other items. This will allow him to continue with his work.

loans.name: Yucenis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yucenis es una bella mujer de 30 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices, también realizará algunas mejoras locativas, compra de sillas, muebles, espejos, entre otros.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Yucenis is a beautiful 30 year-old woman. She is a mother to 4 well brought up children. Since school she developed a great passion and love for everything to do with beauty.

She started her productive activity by taking courses and training until one day she took a chance and decided to find her own clientele setting up a beauty salon in her home. 
 
She is asking for a loan to buy a range of products as she also wants to sell these products to complement her services. These products include: hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dye and nail polish. She will also make some improvements to her salon, purchasing chairs, furniture and mirrors among other items. 

The loan is very important for her as it help her to finish consolidating her business by providing her with all the goods that she needs to operate and offer any service her clients demand. 

Her dream is that her business will develop and progress with the help of Interactuar and that she has many clients.

loans.use: to buy products that she will later sell to complement her services such as: hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dye and nail polish.

loans.name: Karina Maria

texts.es:
Karina, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Sincelejo, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de planchas para el cabello, secadores y esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Karina a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
Karina, in her tireless quest for a better life and better financial stability, started up a business of doing nails and hair. Her business is located in her own home in the municipality of Sincelejo where drive and tenacity are very important ideals for residents in the area.

She has a varied schedule of work every day. She is always busy providing her services since she is very much in demand due to her good work.

She is requesting economic support in order to buy hair straighteners, dryers and nail polish in different colours so that she will be able to provide a better service and be able to keep her business afloat. 

These days she feels happy about the good job that she has been doing up to now which has permitted her to have a more stable job.

With a loan you will be able to help support Paola to continue with the her life plan!

loans.use: to buy hair straighteners, dryers and nail polish in different colours so that she will be able to provide a better service and be able to keep her business afloat.

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
A sus 30 años, Maria tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras en el municipio de Sincelejo.

Vive en una humilde casa con su compañero sentimental y con su hijo a quien enseña el valor del trabajo duro y el valor del cuidado a la familia.

Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como la inseguridad en su sitio de trabajo a causa de los delincuentes.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de 3 lavadoras las cuales le permitirán aumentar su capacidad de servicio y cobertura.
texts.en:
At 30 years old, Maria has a lot of energy and drive to work in her business renting out washing machines in the town of Sincelejo.

She lives in a modest house with her partner and son, to whom she teaches the value of hard work and looking after a family.

Currently she is facing problems in her business, such as insecurity in her place of work due to criminals.

She is asking for a loan to buy 3 washing machines, which will allow her to expand her service capability and coverage area.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines which will allow her to expand her service capability and coverage area.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Nativida es casada no tiene hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad las Queseras ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales , solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos, su sueño es llegar a tener mas ganado y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Natividad is married and has no children. She lives in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province of Ecuador. Nativida lives in the Queseras community where she works in farming and raising animals. 

Natividad is applying for this loan in order to buy a cow to produce milk, and to help Nativida to earn a higher income. 

Natividad's dream is to have more cattle. In her spare time, she likes to volunteer in her community.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Sandra es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
Ella prepara y vende comidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.
Trabaja sola durante 8 horas todos los días.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima como granos, verduras, carne, entre otros, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
It is thanks to Sandra's perseverance and courage that her household can have a decent living. She prepares and sells food in the town of Medellín. She began this work with the desire to find new sources of income to support her family. 

Her husband and children are the biggest motivation that she has to work and try to be better every day. She works alone for 8 hours every day. 

She hopes to be able to boost her business with the purchase of supplies and ingredients such as grains, vegetables, meat and other items. This boost can be given by the Corporación Interactuar and Kiva lenders. With these items she will be able to have food available for her clients at all times.

Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients such as grains, vegetables, meat and other items.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 33 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Beverly has an oyster farming business in the Philippines. Beverly requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy the materials she needs, like bamboo, binder, and other equipment.

Beverly has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Beverly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for oyster farming, like bamboo, binder, and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add more goods to her store, such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 51 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marites has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish making.

Marites has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish making.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto con 47 años, radicado en una zona rural del municipio del Carmen Medelli, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres, lleva varios años con su propia cría de pollos para la venta y distribución. 

Sueña con aumentar el número de pollos para criar y solicito a la Corporación un crédito con el que adquirirá varios de estos animales y los insumos para la alimentación de estos, las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales serán mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is aged 47 and lives in a rural part of the town of Carmen Medelli. He has always worked in the agriculture and livestock farming sector alongside his family which is where he learned about these tasks. He has spent several years raising his own chickens to sell and distribute. 

He dreams of increasing the number of chickens he raises and he asked Interactuar for a loan so that he can buy several of these animals and the supplies to feed them. The profits earned from this increase in animals will be much greater, allowing him to have a better quality of life without as much financial trouble.

loans.use: to purchase several chickens and supplies to feed them.

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.es:
Gustavo es de la ciudad de Medellín, se dedica al comercio hace 15 años, es casado, y con la ayuda de su esposa se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya es muy conocido en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niños, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 

Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa para vender en su casa, de manera a que pueda mejorar sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Gustavo is from the city of Medellín and has been working in sales for 15 years.  He is married, and with the help of his wife, a path has opened and now he is very well known in the area where his business is located.

He works selling clothing for women, men, and children, and this gives him the means to help his family.

He is a very hard-working and determined person who wants to get ahead and have a life filled with successes and triumphs.

He is requesting this loan to purchase an assortment of clothing to sell from his home, so that he can improve his income through his work and can continue growing his business in the best way.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing to sell from his home, so that he can increase his income through his work.

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maria Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell home product care business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Maria Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, etc. for her home product care business.

Maria Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, etc.

loans.name: Zulayz Viviana

texts.es:
Zulay es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 

Desde hace 3 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas con 1 empleado
Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para solventar sus necesidades. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Zulay manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Zulay is a woman dedicated to her family and to her work.  Her tenacity and perseverance have let her move forward, overcoming many obstacles that have presented themselves.  

Three years ago she began her own business, a beauty salon located in part of her house.  Furthermore, she also does home visits, depending on the needs of her clients. 

She works for 12 hours each day with one employee.  This has allowed her to generate sufficient income to cover her costs.   

She will use the requested loan to invest in a hair dryer and wholesale supplies (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, and others).  This will allow her to continue her work and offer a more complete service to her clients in an efficient and agile way, which will benefit her profit margin.  

Zulay states that her greatest desire is to be able to continue her work, strengthen and accredit her business to be more competitive in the market, and in this way have the capacity to giver her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and supplies at wholesale prices  (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polishes, and others)

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 17 years old and is the first of five children in the family. Her mother Evelyn, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her livestock-raising business in the Philippines.

Renalyn is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, with a Major in Management, and is currently in the second year of this 4-year course.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,900 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Renalyn for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

Renalyn plans to to graduate and be employed so she could help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter, Renalyn, who is studying Business Administration.

loans.name: Dúo Sololá Group

texts.es: Dúo Sololá Nazario es propietario de una tienda en el mercado central de peronia y se dedica día a día a su negocio su tienda esta surtida de  granos básicos y productos de consumo diario. El anhelo de Nazario es tener una distribuidora y menciona que es por lo que el lucha cada día,en esta oportunidad el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en: The duo Sololá Nazario is the owner of a store in the central market of Peronia and dedicates themselves each day to their work.  It is stocked with basic grains and daily goods.  Nazario's desire is to have a distributor, and this is what he fights for each day.  With this opportunity he is requesting a loan to buy more daily goods.

loans.use: to buy consumable daily goods.

loans.name: Zorayda

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason of Zorayda’s perseverance. Wanting to see them with a college diploma, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store business. She dreams of a better living condition for her whole family someday.

Zorayda resides in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental with her husband Erwin, a jeepney driver, and their two children. Her husband’s income cannot suffice for their everyday expenditures, thus she decided to operate a variety store that sells various items like canned goods, snack items like biscuits, cookies, candies, packed condiments, sachets of toiletries, and many others. Profit from her business partially covers her family’s expenses, but her children’s education is still a big problem. She desires to earn more profit so she can save better and prepare more efficiently for her children’s educational needs. To improve her business, she is asking for a PhP 33,000 loan which she will use to buy stocks of items to sell. She also plans to start a hog fattening venture so she will buy few piglets and feed. This will further augment their lacking financial resources in the next months. In the long run, Zorayda hopes to renovate their house so it can remain standing in the midst of typhoons and calamities.

Zorayda meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Maira Dolores

texts.es:
Maira, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura junto con ella y tienen una niña de 11 meses de nacida.

Maira, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeña, sus padres siempre se dedicaron a está actividad, es por eso que a ella siempre le gusto trabajar en la agricultura; hoy en día, realiza está actividad junto con su esposo, para lo cual caminan aproximadamente 20 minutos para llegar a la parcela donde están cultivando maíz y arroz. 

Maira, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares y herbicidas, esto le servira mucho a su plantación, ya que con estos insumos obtendra una buena cosecha.  

Maira, sueña con tener una casa más segura de la que ahora tienen y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maira attended school until the ninth grade.  She is married, her husband makes a living in farming with her, and they have an 11-month-old little girl.

Maira has dedicated herself to farming since she was very young.  Her parents always made a living with this activity, which is why she has always enjoyed working in farming.  Today she carries out this work with her husband.  For this, they walk approximately 20 minutes in order to reach the parcel of land where they are growing corn and rice.

Maira needs the loan in order to buy farming supplies like organic fertilizer, leaf fertilizer, and herbicides.  This will greatly help her farm, because with these supplies she will get a good harvest.

Maira dreams of having a safer house than what they have now, and offering a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like organic fertilizer, leaf fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
El señor Juvenal es un mecánico de bicicletas muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de las enseñanzas de su mejor amigo.

Ubica su negocio en la calle, principalmente en las ciclovias de la ciudad de Medellín.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen las bicicletas para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos de bicicletas y herramientas para mejorar la efectividad de sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Mr. Juvenal is a very experienced bicycle mechanic.  He has acquired many skills through the mentoring of his best friend. 

His business is located on the street, on the bike paths of Medellín.

He is a hard working man and honorable man who knows the significance of the bicycles to their owners and because of this, always tries to offer excelente, high quality, and efficient service.  

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and tools to improve the efectuasen of his work.

loans.use: to buy spare bicycle parts and tools to improve the effectiveness of his work.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 44-year-old married woman with two children in school; she works very hard to provide for them and has runa a general store for 2 years. She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, vinegar, and cooking oil.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, vinegar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa prays that someday she will own a big piggery and a shop for painting vehicles. But first and foremost, she prays for good health for her whole family and a completed college education for her nine children. 

Luisa is married to Federico, a painter. Among their nine children, four are studying in college. It’s hard to imagine how they survive and pay for the everyday necessities and educational expenses. But their secret is that they run three enterprises: hog raising, painting of vehicles such as jeepneys and tricycles, and a massage therapy service. Some of their children take turns in nurturing hogs while the others help their father to paint vehicles. The rest perform their household chores. The whole family functions together to ease the burden for each other. 

As of now, they need additional capital for their businesses. Luisa plans to buy more piglets and feeds from a loan amounting to PHP 30,000. She’s confident that her family can take care of more piglets because they know how to divide the tasks. In a few months, the return on investment will be higher and they can provide for their growing financial needs.  

Luisa shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Tigbauan, Iloilo. She has been a dedicated member of the organization for almost twelve years, and she continually gains inspiration from the Bible reflections and through the sharing of life experiences. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feeds

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 48-year-old married woman with two children in school.  She works very hard to provide for them and has run a general store for 13 years.  

She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy condiments, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now needs another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy condiments, snack food, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is 62 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Silvestra runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Silvestra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, homecare products, and other groceries

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is a 41-year-old marriied woman with four children, three attend school.

Joselyn has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She  has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joselyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 51-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Yolanda has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Norma Alexandra

texts.es:
Norma nació en Latacunga, perteneciente a la parroquia Toacazo del cantón Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi de la República del Ecuador tiene 31 años de edad, está soltera, tiene un hijo, actualmente viven en casa de unos familiares en este sector es muy reconocido porque su gente se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Norma  ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, con el esfuerzo y sacrifico de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria, ya que desde que terminó el colegio tuvo que trabajar.
Norma  tuvo muchos obstáculos en su vida  pero  con la ayuda  de sus padres salieron adelante.
Por la falta de recursos económico en un inicio tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar y ayudar a su familian en los gastos, y empezó a criar animales, esto era ya una gran ayuda para su familia, Por el momento solicita un crédito para invertir en emprender su negocio que se trata de crianza y venta de animales.
Hoy Norma  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Norma was born in Latacunga, belonging to the parish of Toacazo, Latacunga canton, province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador. She is 31 years old, single and has a son. Currently, they live in the house of some relatives in this area, which is known for its people working in animal husbandry and agriculture. Norma has shown to be a hardworking and enterprising woman. With her parents' effort and sacrifice she was able to finish high school. Since she finished it, she had to work. Norma had many obstacles in life, but with her parents' help they were able to move ahead. Because of lack of financial resources, at the beginning she had to look for a way to pay for and help her family with expenses, and she started raising animals. This was a great help for her family. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to invest in carrying out her business which is to raise and sell animals. Today, Norma wants to sincerely thank and congratulate Kiva for enabling her personal and professional growth.

loans.use: to carry out her business of raising animals and to enable her personal and professional growth.

loans.name: Leidy Yurani

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 26 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 3 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de su padre y trabaja con 2 empleados todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Leidy manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leidy is a vigorous, helpful, and hard-working woman.  At 26, she is married and a mother of three children whom she has brought up with much strength and dedication.

For three years she has carried out dressmaking work.  She offers the service of dressmaking to third parties and direct customers.  She learned this skill from her father, and works with two employees every day.  Thus she generates enough resources to help her husband with the financial burdens of the household.

Currently she is motivated to request a loan in order to buy wholesale supplies like fabric, thread, and elastic among other items.  This will allow her to have material available to fulfill a timely delivery on the orders that she has pending, thus achieving loyalty from her current customers.

Leidy says she wishes to continue doing her work with great determination, since she wants to expand her business and be able to generate employee opportunities, in addition to guaranteeing financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies like fabric, thread, and elastic among other items.

loans.name: Komsoth

texts.en:
Komsoth is a farmer who lives  with his 3 children, mother, and wife in Prey Gneam village. He earns extra money selling charcoal and wood. 

As a farmer and businessman, Komsoth wants to expand his business and provide a comfortable living for his family. His business needs a reliable energy source to run smoothly. He currently charges a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometimes his busy schedule does not provide time to charge the battery, which results in a  1-day delay to send his product to sell. 

He is applying for a KIVA loan to buy a high quality home solar energy system. He believes his family's living condition will be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prey Gneam Village, Svay Chork Commue, Samaki Mean

loans.name: Miracle

texts.en:
Miracle is an 18-year-old woman with 1 child who sells pancakes, pork cakes, and buns to earn a living. 

Miracle requests a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan for her business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery in the near future. 

She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 29-year-old married woman with four children, three attend school.

Mary Ann has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.

She has borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rhoda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Maria se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como una mujer amable y carismática, con 62 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de comidas que comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años; allí tiene la ventaja de tener una muy buena clientela, pues su restaurante se encuentra en su propia casa. 

Su experiencia en culinaria la obtuvo del conocimiento empírico.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de queso, carne, arroz, verduras, entre otros, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es comprar vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria has been characterized by her clients as a friendly and charismatic 62 year old woman.  She dedicates herself to tending to her own business, as she has a restaurant that she began 3 years ago.  She is lucky to have a good clientele and her restaurant is located in her own house.  

Her culinary experiences was obtained through empirical knowledge.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wholesale stock of cheese, meat, rice, vegetables and others, in order to have a better variety to offer her clients and satisfy their different tastes and needs.  This will generate better sales and income to allow her to continue fighting to achieve her medium-term goal, which is to buy a house that she could share with her family and her business to have a more profitable business and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock of cheese, meat, rice, vegetables and others, in order to have a better variety to offer her clients.

loans.name: Alipio

texts.en:
This loan of $1,000 will allow Alipio to send his youngest daughter to post-secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition and purchase school supplies.

Alipio loves his daughter very much and hopes that further education will help his to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy tuition and purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 31 years old. 

Monica runs a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fish, oils, eggs and biscuits. She makes good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
 
Monica lives near a school in a town. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy things.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fish, oils, eggs and biscuits

loans.name: Eduar  Alberto

texts.es:
Eduar, un campesino muy amoroso y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, específicamente ganado bovino.

Pensando en su vivienda y en su futuro, Eduar quiere expandirse y por tal motivo requiere un crédito para la compra de unos cuantos novillos. 

Con la ayuda de este préstamo tendrá más producción de ganado garantizando una vida económica estable. 

Sueña con tener una finca con mucho ganado rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduar is a loving farmer who has a great passion for nature.  He works with animals, specifically cattle.  In thinking of his house and his future, Eduar wants to expand and therefore needs a loan to buy some young cattle.  

With the help of the loan he will have increased cattle production, thus guaranteeing a more stable economic situation.  He dreams of having a farm  surrounded by many cattle in order to support his family.

loans.use: to buy some young cows.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
For ten years, Emelita has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Tigbauan, Iloilo. She receives tips on how to manage her variety store and animal businesses. Her store sells various commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items, condiments, and many others items.

She raises hogs, ducks, and chickens in her backyard and really works hard in order to supplement her financial resources because her husband’s irregular income doesn’t meet the growing expenses of their family. 

She aims to expand her animal business and variety store to enhance her income and boost her savings. She will use the loan to buy more piglets, chicks, feed, and vitamins. She will purchase additional dry goods and grocery items for her store. She requests 10,000 PHP.  She hopes that your help will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a successful business.

She believes that  happiness and peace among her family members is important. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members  to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a 60-year-old married woman with four children who is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Eulalia has had a dried fish business for 25 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 48-year-old married woman with five children, three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvira has sold a rice for 3 years  and requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a widow from Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. She has two children and she runs three small enterprises: a canteen or food stall, water distribution service, and sale of firewood. It’s very impressive how she manages her household and her three enterprises. For her, it’s just a matter of time management and proper balancing of budget. She says it’s not right to spend without limit; rather, an individual should learn how to keep some amount for times of emergencies.

Merly also knows that profits are irregular due to stiff competition in her lines of business, especially in the canteen business. This is the reason she dreams of expanding it. She plans to entice more canteen customers by preparing wide selections of meal recipes. Eventually, she also plans to renovate her place with concrete so as to stand strong during typhoons. 

For her water distribution service, she aspires that in due time, she will own a refilling station. 

Merly knocks at your kind hearts for a loan assistance of PHP 45,000 that she can use as additional capital for her enterprises. For now, she will use it to buy additional raw ingredients like meats, fish, vegetables, seasonings and condiments. She will use part of the loan to pay for the renovation of her canteen. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and condiments and to pay for the renovation of her canteen.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Sometimes it’s the husband-and-wife’s partnership that makes a business successful. Mary Grace of Tigbauan, Iloilo, finds this to be true. She and her husband run three enterprises. Mary Grace has a direct selling business for personal and home products.  She also sells peanut and vegetables. Her husband, William, sells fish. They work hard to supply their family’s daily needs and prepare for their children's education. They dream of renovating their house someday.

At present, it’s the rainy season, which makes it difficult for fishermen and fish vendors; the price of fish is increasing.  Mary Grace wants to concentrate  on her direct selling business, peanut, and vegetable vending. She needs 10,000 PHP to buy more products and items to sell. Her income  will cover the loss from fish vending. She also plans to save money as additional capital to buy fish when there’s a sudden drop of price. This additional capital will keep their businesses running even during the rainy season.

Mary Garce is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she  meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay  products for her direct selling business,  peanuts, and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 59-year-old married woman with two children, one attend schools. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has been a tailor for 25 years.

Rosalina requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy garments, and other material needed for her business.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy garments and other material needed for her business

loans.name: Liostina

texts.en:
Liostina is a married woman who works hard to support her family through selling charcoal and firewood.

Liostina requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more firewood and charcoal.

Liostina has been in this business for 8 years and earns additional income raising livestock.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and needs a new loan to further build her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luz Francely

texts.es:
Luz es una campesina, humilde y trabajadora con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es una mujer de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeña aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de tomate; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Sonsón.

Esta mujer tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de tomate.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresaria y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.
Ella lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is a humble and hard working farmer with the drive and spunk that distinguishes the men and women of the countryside.  

She is a woman with an enterprising spirit.  She learned rural skills such as cultivation and animal raising from a young age, so much so that she currently cultivates her own tomatoes, which she sells in the plaza of the Sonsón municipal market.  

Her goals are to increase her cultivation and improve what she already has, which is why she seeks the help of a loan from Interactuar Corporation to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, compost, and tomato seeds.  

This loan will give her the opportunity to grow as a businesswoman and as a person, as well as increase her income and continue supporting her home.  All that she wants is to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, compost and to buy tomato seeds.

loans.name: Belmira

texts.en:
Belmira needs $ 1,000 USD to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2005 and will use the loan to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, and slippers.

Belmira earns a good income from selling these products.

Belmira lives in a town with her family and would like to operate a big business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, and slippers.

loans.name: Siumalae

texts.en:
Siumalae is a 22 years old and single. She runs a business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Siumalae requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 36-year-old married woman. They have children who they love so much and are the source of their inspiration. 

Emily is a day care worker and raises hogs. She chose this enterprise because it provides food for the community. Although the return of investment comes after several months, she is happy to provide reasonably priced food for her community in Tigbauan, Iloilo. She is planning to expand her business and buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins. She requests 20,000 PHP. 

She hopes you are willing to help her increase her profit and boost her savings. She looks forward to having a bigger pig pen so she can supply more consumers in her community and nearby areas. She dreams of completing her children’s education that will pave the way to their brighter future. 

She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They meet  weekly to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  squash, carrots, eggplants, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Severiana

texts.en:
Severiana, 49, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Severiana has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Severiana requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Severiana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 55-year-old woman. Victoria works very hard to provide for her family.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Victoria has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Blanca Esperanza

texts.es:
Blanca, de 56 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Medellín, en este negocio vende almuerzos, desayunos y demás comestibles.

Blanca trabaja tres días durante 6 horas, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un gran restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos. 

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen dos de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 56 years old, decided to set up a business in her own home in Medellín selling lunches, breakfast and other meals. She works three days for six hours a day. She is a responsible, rational  woman dedicated to her business.

One of her major unrealized dreams is to own a restaurant where she can offer a greater selection of meals to her clients, and also offer employment.

Blanca is requesting financial assistance to get capital. She will buy meal ingredients including chicken, oil, flour, and more.

The loan will have a significant impact on her life as well as her business. It will allow her to reach her dream and increase the selection of meals available to her clients. Blanca's business provides the income that two of her three children depend on.

loans.use: to capitalize her business and buy meal ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour, and more.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a married woman with nine children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and also earns income as a tailor.  Emerita is borrowing 17,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net.

Emerita has sustained her business  through 19 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and works hard to support her family by operating a  used clothing business for 10 years.

Janet requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy used clothing to sell to her customers.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Antonia De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonia, de 55 años de edad, es ama de casa, por la pobreza en que vivía no estudio, está casada y tiene 4 hijos que aún están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura desde muy pequeño y Antonia, es quien le apoya mucho con este trabajo.

Antonia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años aproximadamente, lo aprendió de sus padres debido a que no fué a la escuela, fue por eso que se enfocó en aprender un trabajo digno que le ayudara a generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia; también se dedica a la ganadería, actualmente tiene 2 vacas lecheras y de la leche hace queso para ir a vender a las casas vecinas de la comunidad.

Antonia, necesita el crédito para comprar una yunta de novillos de repasto, para engordarlos y cuando estén grandes venderlos a un buen precio.

El sueño de Antonia, es tener una casa digna, debido a que la que tiene está bastante deteriorada y se ve afectada por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Antonia is 55 and a housewife. Because she grew up poor she did not go to school. She is married and has 4 children who are still in school. Her husband has worked in agriculture since he was very young and Antonia helps him a lot with this work. 

Antonia has made a living from farming for about 16 years. She learned it from her parents as she did not go to school. That's why she focused on learning a decent trade that would help her to earn the money to support her family. She also works with livestock and currently has 2 milk cows. She makes cheese from the milk to sell to her neighbors in the community.

Antonia needs a loan to buy a yoke for grazing cattle so she can fatten them up and, when they are big, sell them for a good price. Antonia's dream is to have a solid house since the one she has now is badly deteriorated and leaks when it rains.

loans.use: to buy a yoke for grazing cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en:
Iulia is a 21-year-old single woman who has run a business to sell bananas and taro for a year. 

Iulia hopes to expand her business and needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.
