She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 25 years old. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Maria requested a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children, three attend school.  Sherlita works very hard to provide for them by operating a general store for 3 years.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

She requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now needs another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Sherlita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teofila is 63 years old now.

Teofila has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Teofila requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

In the future, Teofila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Pilarita

texts.en:
Pilarita, 34, is a married woman with three children, who are all  in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Pilarita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Pilarita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

In the future, Pilarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia lives in Atsabe. She is married and has three children. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as  aqua, cooking oils, biscuits, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell. Lucia started her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of USD 50. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for more working capital to buy more goods. She also cultivates animals like cows, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: To buy aqua, cooking oils, biscuits, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rinnelyn

texts.en:
Rinnelyn works hard to support her family. Rinnelyn is married and has a business buying and selling sand and gravel in the Philippines.

Rinnelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tons of sand and gravel to sell. Rinnelyn has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Rinnelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tons of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 50 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell. Fatima has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. Jennifer is 34 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jennifer has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her manicure/pedicure business

loans.name: Flor Lizeth

texts.es: Flor de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa propia junto a su  padre con quien se apoya en los gastos del hogar. Flor en conjunto con su padre  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés  en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios a años por lo que actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes gracias a la calidad con que elaboran el pan y así con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos que se le presentan en el hogar. Flor con el deseo, de mejorar su vivienda  está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI  para encementar el área de la cocina ya que es de tierra y le genera bastante polvo que contamina sus alimentos, ella con el monto comprara: grava, cemento y arena para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Flor is 30 years old. She is a single mother and she lives in her own home with her father, with whom she shares the household expenses. Together with her father, Flor has worked for several years making and selling french bread from her residence. Right now she has a lot of customers, thanks to the quality of their bread. With the earnings she obtains, she is able to get ahead with the household expenses. With a desire to improve her home, Flor is asking for a loan from FUSAI to put in a cement floor in the kitchen area. It is a dirt floor now and that generates a lot of dust that contaminates her food. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy gravel, cement, and sand to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement and sand to improve her home.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 45 years old and married with three children. Asuncion works very hard to provide for them.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like junk food, eggs, noodles, and home care products. Asuncion has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Asuncion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like junk food, eggs, noodles, and home care products

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria  es  una joven mujer de 32 años de edad, viven en casa de los padres ya que es soltera , por falta de recursos económicos y la difícil situación de su familia solo pudo terminar con los estudios secundarios, sin embargo María no se dio por venida y desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, y para ser apoyo a su familia en los gastos , tiene un hijo pequeño y tampoco cuenta con el apoyo del padre, viven en un sector extremadamente rural de la ciudad de Latacunga  ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador.
María es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su hogar, ha trabajado desde muy joven en la agricultura y crianza de animales, hoy en dia tiene un pequeño negocio de comida típica de la zona, ella está muy preocupada por  ser un apoyo para su pequeño hijo y su familia ayudar en la economía de su hogar es por eso que está solicitando un crédito para la adecuación de su local lo cual le servirá para  mejorar su estilo de vida. 
María agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Maria is a 32 year old woman. She lives in her parents´ home because she is single. Due to a lack of financial resources and her family´s difficult situation, she was only able to finish her secondary education. Nonetheless, María didn't give up and since she was very small she had to work with a lot of effort and dedication to help her family with expenses. She has a young son and she does not have the support from his father. They live in an extremely rural area of the city of Latacunga, located in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador.

María is a very entrepreneurial, hardworking woman who is very dedicated to her home. She has worked since she was very young in agriculture and raising animals. Today she has a small business selling traditional food from the region. She is very concerned with supporting her young son and her family, helping with the family budget at home. That is why she is asking for a loan to outfit her locale which will help to improve her standard of living.  

María is thankful to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to outfit a locale and give better service to her customers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alicia is 51 years old.

Alicia has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like lotion.

Alicia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like lotion

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 40-year-old mother to three children from Ronda, Cebu. For two years, she has been selling silver jewelry, t-shirts, blouses, pants, and shorts. This earned her 10,000 PHP. This business allows her to help her husband raise their family. She is asking for a loan to buy inventory of silver jewelry, shorts, shirts, and pants that she can even offer on credit to increase her future sales. Rowena plans to expand her business and include items that she does not currently carry. Her profit pays for her children's school fees and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry, shorts, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Nasareta

texts.en: Nasareta is a 47-year-old mother with two children. To earn a living, she runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been doing this for more than a year. Nasareta requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a buy and sell clothing business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of pants, shirts, shorts, etc to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store and buys and sells rice.

Gina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of pants, shirts, shorts, etc to sell.

loans.name: Nicolosa

texts.en:
Nicolosa is 27 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is married.

Nicolosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nicolosa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nicolosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aurea is 56 years old.

Aurea has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber, and other materials needed for her business.

In the future, Aurea would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber, and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
Jorge es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 47 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátanos, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 3 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Jorge manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Jorge Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Jorge, aged 47, is a simple and hard-working farmer, who learned about farm work from his father as a child. 

He currently has a banana plantation, and sells his crops in the village market where he lives. In this way, he earns enough to support his family and pay for the basic necessities for his wife and three children. 

He is requesting a loan to be able to pay for farm supplies in bulk (plant food, pesticides, fertilizer). This will allow him to continue to care for his crops, and to improve the next harvest, which will increase his earnings on each sale. 

Jorge says that his greatest wish is to work hard to ensure economic stability, and to be able to provide his family with better living conditions. 

Jorge can continue to care for his crops and get ahead with your help!

loans.use: to buy farm supplies in bulk (plant food, pesticides, fertilizers).

loans.name: Lora Ian

texts.en:
Lora Ian is 35 years old and has one child who is in school. Lora Ian is married.

Lora Ian is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lora Ian has been farming bananas for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is 62 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a buying and selling of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Hermelina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Hermelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Benedicta works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Benedicta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Benedicta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha live in Atsabe. She is married and she has three children. 

A $1,000 loan is offered to Martinha to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will to use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste, eggs, cigarettes, milk, sugar, gambling cards and other things to sell. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $400. She feels so comfortable to run her business every day because she is earning a good income from her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, biscuits, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste, eggs, cigarettes, milk, sugar, gambling cards and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies to make light refreshments to sell

loans.name: Simalo

texts.en:
Simalo is a 28-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. 

Simalo requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. 

She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast

loans.name: Lauro

texts.en:
This is Lauro, 45, from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. He’s married to Merelyn, 42, and they are blessed with two children.

For twenty years, Lauro has been selling fish in the town’s public market. His wife is helping him all the time. It’s their means to pay for daily household needs and the children’s educational expenses.

But now the rainy season gives him difficulty to earn enough for the family. The price of fish increases during this season and he can hardly afford it. This is the reason why Lauro is appealing for additional capital worth 15,000 PHP to augment his business. He can use this to buy volume and different varieties of fish in order to keep his business running even during rainy days.

His income from this will sustain their daily needs. He can also set aside some amount for his children’s education. Eventually his goal is to make his business prosper, gain stability in the midst of stiff competition, have his children complete their education, and someday enjoy better living conditions.

Lauro is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities and different varieties of fish.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 34 years old and married with two children.

Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Chona has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling broomsticks.

Chona aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Florida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Florida has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, etc.

Florida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rafael es un agricultor muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de plátano que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposa por la cual ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarla adelante.

El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de platano, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Rafael is a very able farmer, experienced in a wide range of agricultural tasks. He has an innate talent for the work, as well as a very entrepreneurial mind. 

He looks after his banana plantation every day, arriving very early in the morning. He currently lives with his wife, and works hard to succeed.

He would like to improve his crop and increase his earnings, and is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as pesticides, plant food and banana seeds. The loan will allow him to grow better quality produce. 

His greatest dream is to own his own home.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies such as pesticides, plant food and banana seeds in order to improve the quality of his produce.
